reviewText: I received a bowl with Elmo on it.  That is where the similarities end... Good price, and my son likes it.

This cup has good quality materials and construction. It doesn't leak and it looks like it's going to last a long time. I took off one star because it does not seem to be shaped for little hands as much as some other sippy cup brands. It is a little wide to hold. But in general I would recommend. It is also dishwasher safe but not microwave safe, just FYI.

I would buy more of these if we had more stuffed animals.  This is great for storage and to organize a playroom or bedroom.  I am a little OCD and like things picked up.  This is perfect and holds about 10-15 stuffed animals based on the size of them.

I got this to go along with the Skip Hop "Treetop friends" nursery bedding set.  It's a not a perfect match with that set, as that one has brighter colors but it still looks great.  The animals are so cute and its gender neutral.  The colors look better in person than here on the web page.  My laundry has to come down two flights of stairs, so the removable inner mesh bag comes in very handy.  If you are going for a neutral nursery theme with birds, trees, owls, or other forest animals you can't go wrong with this.

This or the other one, but you better get it. With it I don't have to search around for lost pacifiers, don't have to dig in the stroller or carseat, or pick it up from the ground and wash it every second.

No complaints - we bought three of these in different colors/textures and all of them are great.  The quality seems much higher than the price we paid.  Hold up very well in the wash and dry quickly.  Super soft for our infant.  This product simply works.
summary: Super-soft, easy to wash and simply cute!

reviewText: I keep this at my house for when my grandson comes. It has worked out very well. Highly recommend. Nice design.
I love this sheet!  It is so soft and stretchy!  I bought aGraco Quilted Pack N Play Sheet, Arden Brownwhich I use as a mattress pad, with this sheet over it.  The combo works great!
summary: Fits Graco pack n play perfectly!

reviewText: I love this car seat and my son seems very comfortable in it. I'm happy that this will grow with him as a final booster. Wish there was just a cup holder on one side, and a snack container holder on the other.  We haven't found a snack container that it will hold.

My 1st born Alexander loved this seat. He would fall asleep in it, no problem. He didn't care too much about the toys, but he wasn't interested in toys until he was too old for the seat. He is 21 months now and loves to sit on the seat. He can get in and out with ease. My second son, Nicholas is four months old doesn't like the vibrations but loves the fish and star. He loves the water and the bubbles noise. He does however like being rocked in this seat and that put him to sleep.It is pretty easy to pack up. I gave this for 4 stars because it is quite loud; the bubbles are really loud. It's louder than the music. Maybe it got that way over time. Like I said with my 1st born we didn't use the toy bar and we have this product about 2 years.The batteries on this thing is pretty good. It doesn't devour them. I accidently left the vibration on for an entire weekend and when we returned they still worked.7/14/2006 UPDATE: The water on the toy bar is half gone. If you are planning on keeping this bouncer for future children, it becomes very loud and annoying. I keep it around because my two boys loves the starfish and fish; however there is not enough water in there to move them. We had the product for two years. If you are planning on having different bouncers for each child this is good bouncer. My two boys each enjoyed the bouncer for different reasons. It is a bit pricey, but I did get good use out of the bouncer.Would I buy it again, I don't know. There are other good bouncers out there for lesser price. Do I regret this purchase, NO! Like I said my two boys enjoyed the bouncer.

Our 10 week old was already trying to pull up from her rumble chair into the sitting position, so it was off to the store I went in search of something to end her frustration.  I skipped the Bumbo, mostly because I had heard from friends with a chunky-legged munchkin that it's leg openings were too narrow (our little girl also has big legs) but compared three other seats.  We looked at the bebepod, the Mama's and Papa's seat (can't remember the name) and this one.  Ultimately, to my surprise, this is the one I came home with.  (I had planned to purchase the bebepod.)  Here's why:1.) Liked that the seat can grow with the child.  The Mama's and Papa's seat also had this option.  Both the Bumbo and the Bebepod are a one-time only fit...once your child is too big it's over.2.) Liked the tray and toys attached.  Not sure how I feel about the toys yet, I couldn't find anything that said they were BPA free which means I typically avoid them, although I know other Summer products are.  She's not able to play with them yet anyway since at nearly 12 weeks now she's only just beginning to be able to control her hands enough to bat something.  We'll see how it goes.  What we do like now is that I put the tray part in front of her and her light up musical turtle (Little Einsteins) and she loves it.  She can watch the lights go on and off to the music while sitting up independently and is starting to try and push the buttons.3.) This one had the highest back of the 4.  Since we were starting using it far earlier than recommended (this one says start at 4 mo, the others at 3) I knew the more support the better.  She has good head control, but can't control her core at all at this point.  Obviously we supervise her in this chair at all times, but it was nice that this one allowed her to be propped up.4.) Decent sized leg holes accommodate her chubby thighs.Some cons:1.) Not sure about quality of the materials.  I saw a review that said the paint wears off, which makes me a little nervous, but we will take a toy away if that starts to happen.2.) Floor use only really.  The base is wide, and it says it can be used for a booster later, but there are no straps to attach it to a chair, which would make me nervous.  For us this was a play seat only (she has a table-side seat for eating later) so we didn't care about that.  Your call if you plan to use it at a table.  (Bumbo has that lawsuit going because someone placed their child on a table in the seat, this one still looks wider and more stable but I'd proceed with caution.)3.) Super bright colors.  This can be a pro or a con.  Pro because it keeps baby's interest.  Con because it's another piece of rainbow plastic to add to your collection.  The Mama's and Papa's seat was a nice white.  (Although it didn't have toys, bebepod did.)Overall this one was the one that seemed to work best for us and so far it is something my daughter enjoys sitting in.  Time will tell if that remains the case, but we're pleased thus far.

I read such wonderful reviews of this mirror, that I couldn't wait to get it.  My baby is only 2 1/2 months old right now, and I find this mirror an irritation.  It takes 2 people to get the mirror placed so that the driver can see baby's face (one person in the back seat and the other in the driver seat).  The smiley face on the frog takes up valuable space.  When trying to get baby's face positioned in mirror, the smiley face frequently cuts straight through baby's face, making her facial expression impossible to see.  Hubby and I worked for 20 minutes to adjust this mirror so that Baby's face was visible from the driver's seat.  Once the baby's face is visible and the frog's smiley face is around the area of baby's neck, the picture is warped so badly that I feel like I'm watching the movie Alien.  I CAN see if baby's head is in the proper position and see if baby is smiling or frowning, making this semi-functional when mirror is placed right.  The biggest problem is that when someone sits in the back seat next to baby, they may touch the hand or foot of the frog as they are buckling themselves in.  If they do, then it moves the mirror and the quest to get the mirror placed correctly starts all over again.  I give this 2 stars because I expect as baby grows, her legs will be long enough to reach frog's belly, and she may find the toy interesting to play with.  At that point, I seriously hope I don't need to see her in the mirror anymore.
summary: Hard to see baby in mirror

reviewText: We had children who were always wanting to get into our guest's room, which had double doors without locks.  We installed these and they work great...you can open them and lock them from either side which is really nice.  You don't need the stick hanging down because you can just slide the mechanism yourself, but maybe if you weren't tall enough to reach it would make a difference.

When my son was a few months old, he could move around and force this thing to come apart no matter how tight we closed it.  And that totally freaked us out b/c it seemed to be dangerous to have him swimming in this long blanket. So we switched to a woombie as he got older.
summary: Good for a newborn, not as good after a few months

reviewText: - great combo of bassinet, crib, and changing table. This is a great solution for those living in small spaces.- love the newborn napper. Although it is impossible to assemble and remove. If you attach it once (with difficulty), and plan on using it for long term use as I did, you will only have to take it off one more time. Then this is great for you. If you plan on attaching and detaching the newborn napper multiple times, look at a different product.- Awesome changing table. I still use it for my eight month old.- love the design. It's gender neutral, and simple. Can use sheets and blankets to play up for baby girl or boy.- love that you can move it around on wheels.- the side compartment is USELESS. It is completely flimsy. Do not plan on storing anything in it, other than maybe a few diapers. I removed mine after the first couple days and have never reattached it.- Graco makes several other products that cost much less, but do not include the side compartment. I decided on this one because of the side compartment. Thus, if I could go back in time, I would buy a different, cheaper product, since the side compartment was completely useless.

We easily set up the system. My hubby took the parent unit to the other side of the house while I made both moderate and low odd noises....he heard them all. Our house is about 1300 sq ft and we have a wireless network. There was no interfererence.  Nice thing, the unit lights up when noise is made.  Very small unit.  I thought it was odd that the Parent unit comes with rechargeable batteries, whereas the baby monitor does not.Update: the baby is 1 year old and we still use it. Great battery power, and can always hear our little one...

These flower/leaf liners are great.  They add something to my basic/plainSummer Infant Ultra Plush Change Pad Cover, PinkandSummer Infant 4-Sided Changing Pad. I like that I get to/have to change them up regularly without having to change my whole changing pad cover as often.  I wish there were more designs to choose from, but these will do for now.They are a little rough, but my baby doesn't mind them.  When on the changing pad, her head is on the regular changing pad cover and her bottom half is on these pad liners.  I'd imagine after a few washes these will soften up.  We also have the plain whiteBoppy Changing Pad Liners 3-Pack - Whiteand I think they've softened up.

I have the original Sophie and my son loves it so I decided to get him this one to see if he liked the scent/flavor.  Well, I was highly disappointed that the one I received was neither scented or flavored.  Nonetheless, my son loves this one just as much.  It's actually easier for him to handle and since it is more firm than the original Sophie I think it helps him when he really want to gnaw on something!  I attach it to one of those pacifier clips so that it is always with him.  An added bonus is that it doesn't squeak!  Even though it's not scented/flavored it's still a big hit!
summary: This was not the vanilla Sophie!

reviewText: My sons love to play with these bath toys. My oldest loves transferring things in general so these were fun for him to transfer water back and forth with. Bonus, they can be cleaned in the dishwasher so no worry of mold like with many of his other water toys that he's had. We LOVE these!

We have been using this crib soother for the past few weeks and it has been great. Our son likes this much better than his mobile that also plays music. These crib soother is great because it has 6 different sounds and what's great is the volume can be controlled from quiet to loud. So many baby toys that we have are either too loud or too quiet and nothing in between so this was a welcome change! The soother also has a timer for 10, 30 and 60 minutes which is also very convenient. The light projector is a big hit with our son also since the stars change with the music. If you're looking for a crib soother, I would highly recommend!
summary: 5 month old loves this crib soother!

reviewText: This bottle warmer definitely is useful - it does what you want it to do.  However, always make sure you test the temperature of the milk before you give it to your baby as it can be to hot (or too cool) sometimes.  This is because there are many variables that affect the ending temperature:- The starting temperature of the milk (from the referigerator, freezer, room temperature etc.)- The type of bottle (i.e., glass, plastic, etc.),- Bottle size (diameter as well as height)- Amount of water you put in hereAs a corollary, be careful with the condensation off the bottle as that can also be quite hot.As far as functionality is concerned, it does what you want, but of course effectiveness is based on the variables I mentioned for temeprature.  The only part I wish this had that some other manufacturers build into the model is an ability to use the steam to steralize baby paraphenalia, such as pacifiers.

I love all the Avent products. I prefer the Avent glass bottles but my daughter's daycare requires plastic. These are a little trickier to clean then the glass ( I just use swish hot water in the glass ones and they are good to go ) but it's not a big deal. I use the Avent bottle brush and soap to get breast milk residue off the sides if these plastic ones. Because the plastic is lightweight my 6 month old can actually hold up these bottles on her own when propped in a boppy and drink milk herself with supervision of course.

This is a great product for strapping your childs toys securely so they don't fall to the floor.  Lightweight and portable.  The strap length is not that long but it's long enough to reach from the stroller bar to my baby.  You can also strap it onto your baby carrier.
Here come the little guys, for the tiny amounts of baby foods.  They stay closed and stack easily. I love that everything can be so neatly stacked.

My daughter received this as a birthday gift for her first birthday. She is now 15mo and has the skills and height (86th percentile) to use it. I loved it right away, it's constructed well and made of easily washable, vibrant, durable materials. She now loves it too. She can easily ride it from hardwood to carpet and turns it with ease so she can choose direction and doesn't get frustrated. Our friends' kids ranging from 2-4 yrs enjoy it as well so I see this bug being a good investment.

I was skeptical in purchasing this. But my 9 month old son loves it and it has helped his first 2 teeth to come through.  I hope he will continue to use it when the teeth all start coming in.This was a great purchase.

I have been a Graco lover for years. I grew up everything Graco and planned to have my children everything Graco. As a first time mom, we started out with the Graco snugride 35 and then switched to the MyRide 65. I'm a member of a lot of mom groups and there is always the debate of Graco vs Britax. My first question was what's a Britax? Fast forward, I am currently having a second child, and after much debate on car space and refusing to purchase another bulky infant carrier; I went with Britax Roundabout, instead of starting out with the new Graco Myride 70 (faints). Big switch for me! After installing it and switching the MYride seating position, we noticed that he was outgrowing it. He will be 3 next week but he is  5% in height. It was time to update his carseat.I looked up the Nautilus and thought it was a sure win. Of course here comes the debate between a fellow Graco lover and a Britax lover. After hearing their reviews and looking into some of my own (video mania), I ended up here, but not lightly. I tried to find the flaws even in the store, but there was none.t arrived in the mail about 3 weeks ago. The installation wasn't as easy as I thought it would be, but installing put Graco to shame. My son is absolutely excited to sit in it everytime we get into the car. It isn't a struggle to tighten the straps after putting him in, and it is difficult for him to escape this carseat in comparison to Graco. It takes me a little muscle to snap the button, so I know he doesn't stand a chance for now.My only complaint (not a big one or can be helped I guess) is when he takes a snooze, his head doesn't naturally fall to the side, it dangles to the front. I'm not sure if there is a way to recline the seat without messing with installation. Otherwise, we have a winner.
Really great product, so glad my sister-in-law recommended them to me. I used them on the changing table and on the bouncy chair for leaks.

These are great because they stop fingers from getting caught at both ends of the door. We all think about the latch side, but it's easy to forget that little hands can get smashed in the hinge side, too. This is the perfect solution. We have been using ours for over a year, and they still work great. Some of them have been cracked from an adult trying to close the door, but they still work fine. They just get a crack at the top. I recommend these to everyone I know with toddlers in their life.

This pumping bra works well and is soft, but it doesn't really compare to simple wishes. The milk itself doesnt feel as secure, it has no straps, and it's not adjustable. I'd be very wary of buying one while you are pregnant since it may not fit when the babe is "out". Still better than not having one of these bras though, they are great if you are a big pumper.

This is the perfect amount of squishy/firm for frustrated kiddos trying to work on their teeth.  And I love that you can freeze it/put it in the fridge to provide extra relief.  It is pricy for a teether, but it works great!

Easy to install. People claim having problems separating the gate from the mounting strip, but lubricating it when you install it prevents issues. The wood looks nice, but it does have a slight green tinge when the sun hits it. It looks really nice at the top of our stairs, blends with the decor very well (some gates are so tacky!). And it swings closed pretty well. We like that it feels very secure.

Great quality stroller. I chose this one over other brands, like Maclaren, because of the extra large canopy (keeps baby out of the sun really well) and because the back reclines flat... And I think I made the right choice! I just love it!

I got this for my wife to use when giving the grandkids a bath.  She has mixed feelings about it.Pros: nice cushionGood sizeEasy to storeEasy to cleanCons: slippery when wet.  Her knees slide off of it when it gets wet.  You use it while bathing a small kid - it always gets wet.A more textured finish would really make this product s lot better.  Good overall, but not great.
Awesome. I used this cover so many times when my baby was tiny. You need to buy the cloth diapers still, but this cover is excellent at containing/preventing blowouts.

We use this as our night diaper, with an additional insert, and a thirsties diaper cover.  Yes, we also are disappointed that this diaper is missing the double gussets, but the covers have them, so we are ok.One star off for lack of double gusset, and the other star off for misleading sizing.  I would say the size 1 fits up to 15 pounds, and size 2 can fit as small as 14 pounds.  I switched from size one to two when my baby began weighing 14.25lbs. This is one of the only diapers left that has the main pad sewn-in, which I like.  just remember to turn it inside-out when going from washer to dryer.
This is a great, and cheaper, alternative to the Bumbo chair. My son loves sitting and playing in it for as long as a 4 month old's attention span allows. Love that it grows with him!

These breast shields are a perfect fit for me in the regular size -- they work exceptionally well without any leaking. The fit is comfortable during pumping, and I've never had any pain or discomfort after I was finished.

Introduced this sippy cup to my 6 month old daughter, and she just turned 9 months and can drink from it! Loves chewing (with her gums) on the spout too because she's teething. Not sure how well it'll hold up when she chews on it after having even 1 tooth in. Will update then!Pros:1. Pretty2. No spills3. Easy for babies to hold (just don't fill it up - if your baby is too young. They won't drink all that water anyways)4. Run it daily in the dishwasher - and its holding up beautifullyCon:A lil pricey!

Best pacifier clip! I like that's it's not metal like most that I've seen because my baby likes to chew on it. Just don't put it through the washing machine/dryer, the rubber part started peeling off and it needed to be replaced.
Is easy to use and clean. You can prepare yours fruits puré and soup very fast. Is a good product.

Product is super cute. The banana can be unpeeled because of velcro. Orange, also with velcro, can be split in two. The shopping bag is sturdy. The packaging was seriously impossible. The fruit/vegetables were attached together and also to the shopping bag. They were attached very tightly and it was very difficult to snip with the scissors without cutting the fabric. It took me at least 10 minutes to separate all of the fruit/vegetables. It was totally unnecessary to package it like this. Couldn't all of the items been placed in the shopping bag and then place the whole bag in a plastic bag? If you buy this wait don't try to unpackage it if you are having a bad day!

This is the third activity center that I tried before I fell in love. The Baby Einstein and the Boppy one both failed before this beauty. This is the perfect size, great colors, great toys, great mobility, great lighting/music! Overall a great, great product that my 10 month old still loves. The monkey that came with this is still one of my baby's favorite toys. Comes with a mirror, rattle, monkey and much more...Great toy!

These are about the size of a wash cloth.  They are definitely water proof.  After our son was born we used these in the napper section of our pack and play and also underneath is bottom in the car seat.  We really haven't used them much since he was small.  At 9 months, we are still using the Keep Me Dry bassinet pads on our changing table.  I highly recommend those if you are looking for something a little larger.

I love this version of Munchkin's formula dispensers better than the newer ones that are in stores. The lid stays on yet is easy to open when you need it. - no worries about it spilling in the diaper bag! The design also allows you to get all the formula out.
love it.  runs a little large.  it is stiil big on my 23 lb son, so i can only snap 3 snaps, but it still works well.

These letter magnets have been such a hit in our playroom. The fun colors and patterns help make learning letter fun. They stick to our magnet board (which is a piece of sheet metal covered with fabric and framed) without trouble. You should realize they are small - check the size to make sure they are what you want - they were perfect for us.
Holds all my daughters treats and if I want, holds hot and cold snacks as well - blueberries have held up for several hours in hot temps.  Great buy and very durable.

My son hated everything -- the swing, the bouncer, the rocker, the napper, the jumper, the Bumbo... you name it, we tried it.  My boy, from the get go, never liked to be strapped in.  I put him in the Joovy Spoon as soon as he could sit independently and he was smitten.  He learned to scoot in it almost immediately... maybe 2 or 3 tries... and absolutely loved it.  He ran at full speed and slammed into walls for months and I think it really helped him to walk, which he did at 11 months.  It is AWESOME for snacks and toys and sometimes my boy would just sit parked in it watching Adventure Time snacking.  I was seriously sad when he was strong enough to climb out of it.
These are a nice soft cotton and fit the pack and play very well. I got the white ones so that they could be bleached if needed, but they work great.

I love grovia! I prefer these soakers over the stay dry for my baby as they hold more on him. But I'm writing this more to address other comments and easy fix solutions to them. First off you must properly prep the soakers. If they aren't prepped they won't work! Secondly, they do take a long time to dry if dried by themselves. Throw a towel or two in and you will cut around thirty minutes off your dry time. Third, they do need a booster for nighttime. But honestly every diaper I've ever tried does on my heavy wetter. That or your putting a special cover on. It's a fact of life when cloth diapering. Hope this helps!

I just started using this mirror and so far I am happy with it. On all these mirrors, the actual mirror past of it is cheap but you can see what you need to see so that is all that matters. It does move from side to side so I need to figure out a way for that to stop happenning but it is wide enough to see the entire car seat and I have a ford taurus and was able to put it in without a problem. I would recommend this mirror.

I absolutely LOVE these products. I bought the changing table size and this size.  I love them because I can use them and throw them in the washing machine and then use them again. They wash up beautifully and there is no waste like I would have with disposable pads and my granddaughter seems to find them very comfy.
I should have read the reviews  :(  REALLY need a choice of colors on this product so everyone doesn't end up with pink.  Lots of unhappy customers with boys.
summary: Do not buy if you have a boy.

reviewText: Since my husband is the primary user of this product, I asked him for input when rating this product. His quick response was, "I like it. It's easy to use," thus the not-so-clever headline for this review.In our household, this sterilizer is used multiple times a day... for two reasons: (1) I am an over-producer when it comes to breast milk, and (2) we're cheap and don't want to buy a whole much of bottles. Currently, we mostly use the 5oz Medela bottles and 4oz cheap-o bottles that we got from the NICU.We don't exactly follow the grooves in the sterilizer and have found our own way of arranging the bottles and lids. We are able to sterilize 8 bottles and 8 lids at one time. We also sterilize my pump parts in here a couple times per week. We used to sterilize bottle nipples, but have not in a long time because our 6-month-old baby has a lot of health issues and actually lost the skill and desire to eat orally. We feed him everything through an NG tube right now. (It's hard, but that's the only way we can get him fed these days. Sniff, sniff.) It takes 3 minutes in the microwave, so it's pretty darn quick.Our only minor complaint about this sterilizer is that two of the grooves can sometimes cause the Medela bottles to topple. But we realize that this is probably because this sterilizer was made for Philips AVENT bottles, so we don't feel right deducting any stars for this complaint.
I love this change pad.  It stay on my diaper bag to use when we are out and about.  I don't have to worry about where I change my little one.

Great walker and easy to clean.  My 5 month old is only in the 42% for height and is too short for it, so we had to modify the height adjustments to allow for him.  There are 3 options on the walker for this, we had to use a wood block system to create more.  He loves hanging out in the walker though.  We like how the front wheels are telescopic, so he can easily turn, however, the design would be better if the back ones were too.  Every now and again the wheels get cocked to the side getting him stuck.  If all were telescopic that would not happen.
summary: Great walker and easy to clean

reviewText: These are great plates- I love that they have lids, so leftovers go straight into the fridge instead of dirtying another container. The vented lid is perfect for microwave heating. I've had them for several months now and they've been through the dishwasher no less than a dozen times each, and they've held up perfectly. Highly recommended.

Love medela products!  Never had a problem.  Also, many have told me if you do have a problem, medela will fix it!  Butyou do have to buy the collars separately and the cheapest I've found to do that is directly from medela.

I bought 2 storage boxes for the IKEA book shelf unit.To upgrade my 2,5 yrs son bedroom from nursery to toddler room.I bought  the gorilla and dragon ones for his room.He likes it and it is great for storing toys and clean up.For my daughter's nursery I have the storage bag which is cute and does it's purpose.For our living room in Europe I bought this bin and the peacock box because they had the best prize.This because I think these storage boxes look nice in a living room. They are delivered flat, which is perfect for my suitcase and is half the prize here as it is in euro's overthere!
summary: For storing toys a stylish way

reviewText: This is a great seat protector.  Our son spilled a milk shake in the car and it dripped through the car seat onto the mat.  The mat saved our upholstery and cleaned up with a damp rag!  Great!  It is very thick and sturdy, and the car seat does not slide when placed on it.  It also keeps your vehicle seat from getting indentations from the car seat as well.  It also covers the whole seat top to bottom.  I accidentally bought a Kiddopotamus cover for our younger son thinking it was this one and it doesn't go all the way up the back of the seat to protect it from indentations from the car seat...plus it's not as thick as this one.

I really like this receiving blanket. The only thing that boggled me was how much it shrunk after the second wash. I can still use it, but not for the purpose of snuggling my newborn (he's quite long). Other than that, good product.

We recently bought a new car and my husband and I are still in that obsessively cleaning the car phase and the rearfacing kiddo putting his feet on the seat back was bothering us. So this does the job of protecting the seat. I have two diono seats and two of these covers and it is just barely bigger than the carseat itself, so it doesn't do the best job of keeping crumbs and whatnot off the seats like I was hoping but that's fine.I will say the pockets at the bottom are not really usable for anything. We can fit matchbox cars into it but that's it. It's just very tightly sewn so there's not much give to put anything else in it.

I own both a Pack N Play and a Naturpedic portacrib mattress and don't feel comfortable using this product with either.  It is soft enough that I don't feel comfortable putting my 3 1/2 month old to sleep on it for fear that he might suffocate if he turns over (which he is doing).  I will use it for daytime, supervised naps and for just hanging out, but not as a mattress pad for overnight use.

I was looking for a second diaper caddy for my youngest baby. When they say colors may vary, they're not kidding. Mine showed up baby pink/brown! It is too soft to hold its shape while open, and you can't really fit diapers and wipes without stacking them on top of each other in the "big" pocket. I returned the product and will spend the money on another JJ Cole diaper caddy...I now see that the $30 is worth it for my needs.
•Soft, silicone tip gentle on teeth and gums•Long, slim handles makes feeding baby easier•Dishwasher-safe•BPA-FREE•Available in 2pk and 6pk; For 4m+
summary: Gerber Graduates BPA Free 6 Pack Soft Bite Infant Spoon, Colors May Vary

reviewText: The sling was great when she was an infant, but when she hit for months she was too long for it... but she couldnt quite sit up on her own so I had to multi task by supporting her and washing her. The seperate shower was a great idea. The flow was hard against her. But the button on the side of the handle opperates the shower, you have to hold constantly for the thing to work. There is no setting, just push and hold. It can wear your thumb out. It's hard to handle sometimes, like when she grabs on the hose... she actually stops the flow of water. It's ok, but I'd look for something else.
Great quality fabric, I only used this with covers so I don't know if its as water resistant as claimed but the contour is great!
I thought this item may have been larger and it's tiny. This was a baptism gift and almost felt like I shouldn't give it. it was still cute.
These are good spoons - small enough to tuck into a travel pack - I prefer the long handled, all plastic spoons - but these work and the small size is nice when you need them to tuck into bags.
My 4 month old daughter loves this teether! It's very easy for her to grip, play with, and teeth on whether she's on her back, sitting up, or on her stomach. I'd recommend it to anyone!

Lamaze toys are great.  Any toy you buy from these guys are wonderful.  The ring is great to latch the toy to the car seat, stroller, etc and ensure that it won't fall off.  Textures, sounds and colors are super fun for my baby

This is a great potty seat and stool.  My 2 year old son loves the Cars print and wants to use the potty.  He also sits on it longer because he likes looking at the pictures. He's proud of his potty seat and stool.

I tried out many reuseable snack bags and these were my favorite mini version. I use them for my son's snacks during the day - mostly for dry snacks. I either wash them with a bottle brush or put them through the laundry. They've held up well. The only thing I wouldn't use them for again is dried seaweed. The little dried seaweed pieces jammed up the zippers.

My granddaughter is expecting my first great-granddaughter in a couple of weeks and she had this on her wish list.  She was so happy when I gave it to her at her baby shower.  Said she had researched a bunch of them and this was the one that she thought was the best.

I originally liked the design of this snack cup because it's easy to hold, has a nice no slip grip, the opening is a good size for my daughter's tiny hands, is easy to open and fits perfectly into the cup holder on a stroller or high chair, however, after using it for a week, the latch lost it's grip and won't stay shut anymore. I can't even keep it in the diaper bag without it popping open and making a mess. She also dropped it once in the store and her snack went everywhere.I much prefer theOXO Tot Snack Disk, Aquanow. It's super easy to clean but hate that it doesn't fit in the cup holder like this one does. Find a way to combine these two and I'm sold!

I was looking for a crinkle toy for my baby, and was disappointed that the crinkle material is only inserted in the head of this bear Given the very small size of the toy, it is pointless for little children - they have to possess quite good fine motor skills to make crinkle sounds
summary: Very small and not completely crinkle

reviewText: Daughter loves this, both the book and the mirror side.  I wish they made more switcharoo products because it's nice to made her exersaucer or jumper "new again".

My 18 month old was escaping from her high chair and wanted to sit in a big seat at the table. I thought she was a little young for a booster, but I got this anyway. I was looking for a bargain since it was an unplanned purchase. The other one I ordered had a shipping date of 4 weeks away, so I canceled and got this one. She really likes it! It buckles safely to the chair and has a good belt to keep her in. She enjoys sitting in it and never fusses like she did in her high chair. I can push the chair all the way in when she's done, and it slips out of sight under the table.

We got this diaper bag because it's a neutral looking style/color (orange and gray) for my husband and I to both carry, and has an adjustable strap for our very different heights and body types.I need the bag straps much much shorter than he does, and when the bag is shortened to the extent I need it to be carried, over the head/shoulder and across the chest so I can carry 1yr old and have free movement to hold 2.5yr old's hand the bag is completely uncomfortable.  I've had cheap/free bags from the hospital or give-a-aways that are better suited for us.Also when in shortened position, the metal slider either gets in the way of the shoulder pad so it doesn't actually sit on your shoulder, it is either on your chest/back or you can force the slider to go into the shoulder cushion, but then the cushion sits funny and is also uncomfortably feelable underneath.Not at all versatile if you need something more than 2 people will be carrying/sharing.
Just for the record, these have NO stems and are ONLY for the Duo pump. I got a pair for free from Philips when I called them with a question (they are SO nice) but I decided I wanted a backup pair.
summary: Do what they are supposed to.

reviewText: This pillow was a little disappointing as the filling doesn't hold up as well as I though it would especially for the price! I used at from 5 months of my pregnancy and by the end, it was pretty much flat. I wasn't too impressed with that.
I would choose some other toy over this one for 4-6 month olds, for sure.  This doesn't hold either of my twins attention very well, and doesn't stick as well as other similar toys.
summary: Would pick other spinner over this one.

reviewText: this bowl is awesome for the simple fact that the super strong suction means that the bowl stays where you put it. I wish the company also made a rimmed plate or some sort of shallow bowl, but, as is, this product is awesome.

cute and modern design for the best kid plate on the market!!as a plus as being a "reel" non-slipery plate, this one feature a upper part slightly curved toward the inside to avoid baby to push all the food over the border while trying to catch it in her spoon, when the spoon technique is finally mastered, just remove the upper part and get the perfect size plate for your toddler! who said plates couldn't be evolutives?!

I bought a pair of these after unsuccessfully buying the bottle brushes at the local store. I like the main brush, it is sturdy and fits all my bottles, including the glass Evenflo and Medela bottles. However, the nipple attachment broke after a week of occasional use. The bristles started coming out little by little, and now after two weeks, all the bristles came off rendering the nipple brush useless. If you need only the main brush, then it is a great product, but if you are like me and was looking for the smaller brush to wash the nipples, then look elsewhere.

I bought this towel after reading many of the reviews concerning the reverse side of the towel shrinking because I was hoping that 3 Sprouts had changed the product to look like what is pictured, which shows terry cloth on both sides. This is not what I received; the back of the towel is the same cotton fabric the elephant is made of. It is very soft, but has in fact shrunk as the other reviews have stated. We won't be able to use it for long as my daughter continues to grow! The redeeming quality this towel has is the adorable elephant; my daughter loves it and is happy to be wrapped up in this towel regardless of its short comings (no pun intended).

Have only used this a few times, but so far so good. I strapped it tight to the chair and had no issues with it collapsing. My baby is about 16 lbs and can sit well unsupported and this works well for us when we go places without a high chair.UPDATE: when we decided to move DD to the table with us instead of the high chair we ended up using this daily for about 4-6 months. I don't think it's intended for this kind of heavy use, but it held up to it well. We finally did get a chair that attaches to the table and seems a little more supportive, but we still have this portable booster in our closet in case company comes over with a kid or we want to take it somewhere. It works on pretty much any chair, which makes it incredibly useful. It doesn't feel super sturdy, seems really to be made of a heavy cardboard or something similar under the material, but it holds up surprisingly well. Very lightweight and easy to take anywhere.

These drop-in liners are great. However, some of the liners were very squished and collapsed already while in the box. So I had to stretch them out so I could put the formula in. No biggy, but just odd. These are convenient and worth the money. I recycle them too after use and rinsing. Good product.

We have two boys, and are expecting our third - a girl. We didn't want to have to buy a new carseat/travel system, so we bought this as re-vamping alternative!  It looks fantastic, fits wonderfully on the Chicco carseat, and makes it look new. It also makes the green/gren color scheme we chose for the boys into a pretty pink and brown one for our girl. We live in Houston, and I can already tell it will block sunlight while remaining breathable and airy inside. Great design, very happy with our purchase!
summary: Was a great spash of paint on an old car seat!!

reviewText: This is a great tray for a 3-10 year old kid to keep them busy in their car seat on a long road trip. It is great for multiple activities including drawing or writing, putting a tablet, small laptop or media player to watching a movie, for dry snacks, etc. It is very versatile and you might find that this works for something that you didn't initially thought about.Another great thing that I love about this is that it’s washable. Although if your kid spills liquid on it, it will take some time to dry it. If it were plastic, you could just wipe it. But then it would be dangerous because it could also hurt your kid. So the material (i.e. Nylon with soft foam) makes it very safe for kids. If you suddenly hit breaks, this won’t hit your child and hurt him/her. Plus, this material makes it very easy to fold and store.This is a great little travel tray that more than filled a need. I think it is durable and should last for some time. For the value it provides, I highly recommend it.

We have an active baby and hardwood floors.  This mat is just soft enough for him--I know he won't bash up his big, bald head when he's rolling around with his toys, nor do I have to worry about him biting off pieces (Seriously.  That's what I saw in other product reviews.) when he starts teething.  The colors are nice and neutral--it looks a little less like the plastic baby s*** I so despise--and it's a nice size for a little one, but bigger babies might need two sets.A win for the family, overall.

The holes fall out! You can't even move these one inch without the stupid middle holes falling out. Who invented these? They're just awful to use. I ended up duct-taping the circles into the squares. The playmat is super thin and I couldn't use it on a hardwood floor, it is barely soft enough on carpet.
summary: These are the worst invention possible.

reviewText: So this has served a couple of different purposes already!One - We used it at the hospital. With the nurses coming in and out through the night this made it easier without having to turn on the room lights and check on the baby.Two - Our child is sleeping in the bassinet /play pen for the first few weeks in our room. Its great to throw it into the corner of the play pen and check up on him without having to turn on the lights.Other intended uses- We plan to use this for traveling too. its small enough to take anywhere. I think its more permanent home will be by the changing pad to change him at night.Pro's- Great battery life so far. Lasts a full night.- Like the different colors. Except maybe the red but green and blue are nice.- Cool to the touch.Cons- I wish the timer feature could be changed. Then again I haven't looked back at the instructions to see if that is possible
I would love to buy all the Lamaze products, they are great for babies... My son loves it, it's the perfect toy to take

reviewerName: Spends too much time on Amazon Mummy of three...
reviewText: I chose this item because Amazon suggested that this was a good choice and was frequently bought together with the Graco Pack and Play and The American Baby Play-yard sheet.  Needless to say it doesn't even remotely fit the pack and play pad (way too small) and of course the item has been washed and packaging thrown away so no opportunity to return.I will say however that the pad feels nice - I only wish it was in fact the right size.

When picking items out for our twins we came across the Bundle Me It felt so warm and cozy inside almost like a big blanket! So we reg for both a pink for our girl and blue for our son. Im so happy we did. It getting cold here in WI and sooner the snow will be flying. This is already coming in handy. Since me and my husband LOVE to walk on weekends or nights after work we have used this now a few times when its chilly. No need for blankets or jackets. And now with winter right around the corner this will come in great! We take them out everyday to their grandparents home. This will keep them warm and out of the wind. We have the Graco infant carseats, the Eddie Bauer infant carseats and their grandparents also have Graco seats. They fit so easily in all of them. And mornings when i take the babies over i just take them right out of the carseat right in the bundle me. Its just like a big fuzzy jacket, that they can use when they go out with gampa/grama. Its alot easier than trying to get 2 jackets, mittens hats,etc on 2 6 month olds. All around this is GREAT product and im so happy i have them!
It's soft and it's fluffy. What more could you want from this? Its strap openings make it a perfect for the Summer Infant Contoured Changing Pad, which I bought this for. Perfect cover!
this pacifier clip is really cute and is not easily pulled by my baby, it's also easy to clean and seems to be safe

This is a great product! It is excellent since you can use your own trash bags in it and don't have to buy special ones. You can also put the diaper in it using only 1 hand! I gave it 4 stars only since 'once in a while' if the bag is very full, I may notice a slight smell.  But it is truly worth buying! I love mine!

We had a family bassinet that I intended to use, but it didn't seem sturdy enough for my comfort.  I got this to replace it and LOVE that I can have him laying practically right next to me.  I can reach out my hand and hold his while we both sleep. It's a comforting feeling for me and well worth the price in my opinion.  I love that it's on wheels so I can move him wherever I need if he's napping.

I ordered this gate to fit a 42" doorway and the product description states that it will fit a 42.5" doorway. When I received that gate in the mail and took out the instruction manual, it provided diagrams detailing how to use extensions to make the gate 39" and how to make the gate 49" (with extensions that are larger and not provided). I was ready to return the product but decided to take it out of the box and measure it and found that it actually does extend to 42.5" but that the manual just doesn't show this configuration of extensions. We have had to return several baby gates because they wouldn't work with our baseboards, but this worked like a charm. It's nice that you can either screw these into the wall or use the sticky tabs provided- I chose to use screws and the gate doesn't budge. It feels very strong and secure- not cheap at all. I'm happy with the purchase so far- will update it if we have any issues!
summary: Manual is Misleading but Product is Great

reviewText: I installed this mirror on the middle seat headrest but was unable to adjust it to where I could see baby in her rear seat facing carseat. It also distorted my ability to see out of back window. The mirror itself is great! Large area, durable, etc. Had to return it.

My only problem so far with this is that the battery dies too quickly! Or maybe my son just uses it too much.  Even when I put a new battery in the motor doesn't make as strong vibrations as they did at first.  Otherwise my son loves it.  It's still holding him @ 4 months and 20 lbs.  He's not all that into the toys but with them being removable it's an easy fix and I can just give him his regular toys to play with while he's sitting in it.  If I'm not using the swing for him to nap he is usually found napping in this.
The clasp on this pacifier holder is really tough, it takes two hands to get it open. Sometimes that is kind of hard when you are holding a baby. Other than that it works just as advertised.

We bought this as we are frequent travelers! It is so nice to pull (or push) baby like a precious little piece of luggage! This has come in handy for early morning flights when baby fell asleep on the way to the airport and we just transferred the carseat onto the travel cart and we were on our way without disrupting baby! It fits on tight and is simple to install onto cart. It also fits in the carseat cover, still attached, which is helpful for quickly disembarking the airport. We get compliments on it everywhere we go!

Very soft and comfortable. i have two of them so I always have a clean one in case of accident.. and they happen !So far all stains washed out perfectly and it seems to come out just like new from the washing machine ( I use hot water, oxi clean and laudtry detergent as well as laundry softener) followed by dryer with dryer sheets.They do not shrink, easy to put on and off the changing mat. Love them !

This is my 5th potty chair and so far the best for a boy that I have found.  The pee still splashes out occasionally, but far less than all the other brands.  It makes me so mad that they don't have boy-specific potty's.  The splash guards are always too small and they leak ( like our defective Thomas potty seat)  So I am happy to have this one as a big improvement.  My son is on the large side he is 34 pounds and 36 inches tall and just turned 2 last month. He fits on it just fine and likes that he can lean back.

Like other reviewers I looked around a lot of stores and did a lot of research for a crib mattress.  Wow! This mattress was far superior to anything I found at the Baby stores or Walmart, Target, etc. Especially for the price. In order to get a similar mattress at the baby stores it was almost double the price.  Anything in the $150 price range or lower was also very low quality.  This mattress is very sturdy and comfortable feeling. We bought a crib that converts to a toddler bed so we need a mattress that will last at least 3-4 years and be comfortable as baby grows.  I am extremely happy with this purchase - Thanks Simmons and Thanks Amazon!!

reviewerName: Amazon Customer "the goth chick with an offic...
reviewText: These flanges are wonderful. The angled shape allows gravity to work for you while pumping. Milk flows downward -- ingenious!  Also, these allow you to sit more comfortably while pumping -- no more leaning forward!The graduated shape was also more comfortable for me. Additionally, the bottom of the flange has several grooves that prevent milk from dripping out of the flange when it is removed after pumping, which means I don't have to pump with a towel in my lap or worry about dripping all over my pants. These flanges are fantastic and have made pumping much easier. Anything that makes pumping easier is a bonus in my book!
I love this. Its super cute and I wish that it jsut took AA batteries. I loved the ocean sounds and the cute little creatures and so does my son. pretty awesome
I have a 6 week old and she is starting to notice lots of things so these toys are perfect. It keeps he happy in her car seat and stroller.

I put this under the fitted sheet for the  Graco Travel Lite Crib  and it works like a charm. Keeps the pad underneath clean. I also put these on the floor after a bath, when I'm putting on lotion and dressing the baby. These are just so handy and keep anything underneath completely dry. Wash very well. I've washed these many, many times in my HE front load washer and dryer and they hold up great.
summary: Great for use under bassinet sheet

reviewText: I hated leaning over with traditional shields.I almost have up pumping several times because of heart breaking spillage and a sore back.The angles provided me with more comfort and no issues fitting them into a pumping bra. Fit well with my Madela Freestyle.

I started with the Halo Swaddle sleep sack, which I loved, and I have bought it in sizes S-M-L also.  They're perfect because they keep babies warm and there's no way for it to be kicked off nor can it ride up & cause suffocation.  It unzips fromThe bottom which makes for easy diaper changes.  I would definitely recommend this product (and have many times).

This rain cover fits perfectly on my Chicco Keyfit 22.  I use it with my Keyfit Caddy and it keeps baby totally dry.  We went on vacation to a place that is typically rainy and windy.  This also worked great for blocking the wind.  It's a little bulky so it doesn't stay in the diaper bag, but when it looks like it's going to rain I throw it in the under basket.  It keeps the car seat and baby totally dry!  It's sturdy too. It's made many trips and been bunched into a ball many times, but doesn't look worn at all.  Baby has plenty of fresh air from the side vents and the plastic is taut enough that she can't pull it it play with it. I recommend this.

This was a very good purchase for us.  The padding is nice (I also supplement it with a body sized bath sponge underneath for added comfort) and it accommodates cart seat belts nicely.  The fabric is a soft, high quality cotton.  I recommend with no hesitation.
These are a must!  They save me from washing sheets and changing pad covers on a daily basis.  This particular one is the perfect size for using on a changing pad.  I use different ones for the crib.

I like this toy a lot but my 7 month old isn't even fazed by the spout. Maybe he'll like it more when he is older. I purchased to use in a Primo Eurobath and the suction cups don't get a good grip on the side. I'm assuming it would be fine in a regular bathtub but, just a heads up, it doesn't attach well to the side of the baby tub. My son does really enjoy playing with the cups even without the spout. And I must say I'm kind of impressed with the pressure it's able to achieve for a little battery operated toy.  All in all, I'd purchase this again and even give it as a gift.

This is a great product. I leave it on the counter and throw in pacifiers, WASHED bottles, etc all day then throw in the microwave when full. Uses much less water and energy than running the dishwasher.
This adds color and character to our nursery. I really don't think the room would be as lively without it. Great buy!

I thought this was going to be adorable.  However, the royal blue color of the eyes and especially the smiles was so bright that it almost gave the animals a frightening, or menacing look.  If that doesn't bother you, the rug is otherwise cute. Quality is fair....but reasonable given the price.
summary: Blue in smiles to bright for the rest of the rug

reviewText: I needed another changing station and ordered this instead of the traditional wood frame, changing pad, and changing pad cover. This changer is 3 and one and when you add up all the money you would have spent on the other 3 things it is worth the price. It doesn't slip off the dresser and seems comfy for baby. If I would have known about them when I bought our original changer I probably would have ordered one then too.The only down side are the weird colors it comes in. I understand they wanted to be "funky" or "hip" with the colors, but the shades are just ugly and probably do not match many people's decor. I chose the aqua since it was the least offensive color. Couldn't they offer a white or a light grey??? There are some minor minor impression dings on mine, but the color coating did not break so I'm living with them.

I don't know why so many people have had problems with leaking. It must be operator problems because I've never had that problem. I don't notice any excess gas either. We just burp her once and that's all she needs. I breast feed exclusivly so we only use the bottles on occasion but she has no problem switiching. They really do promote breast feeding. We used the Playtex bottles first with the drop ins but they were really hard to warm up. We have the Avent bottle warmer (which is also great) and the bottles are so easy to warm so you're not trying to hurry while your baby screams of hunger. They are simple to clean, no extra parts. I would reccomend them to anyone.
summary: These are great! I love them! Best Bottles I've Used

reviewText: I got this for my arms reach bassinet and it fits great. Its really soft and the animals are fun.

I've tried many other brands, but these (along with the Gerber cotton burp cloths), are simply the best on the market by far.Great size, great construction, great value and fun prints/colors.Don't be swayed by the swanky high end products - remember, this is for your infant to spit up on, not wear as a fashion statement.
This mobile is bright, colorful, and good for either gender.  Easy to assemble.  Some wings seemed a bit loose, so I will be gluing them on, just in case.  Love it.
We had to get doors and this lock to keep our little one from the fireplace. Since we got the lock she hasn't even tried to get into the fireplace. Easy to install.
My friends baby cannot take her eyes or hands off this little puppy.  We attached it to her car seat and she is mesmerized by it.So, of course I ordered more!  Lamaze really "gets" children!
summary: Love these Lamaze toys and so do the babies!

reviewText: I love this, I can pump while working or doing other stuff.  Just throw on the hooter hider over it and you're in business!

This crib skirt fits perfectly and is a nice subtle addition to the cribs' decor. My only complaint is that after washing it, you have to iron. BUT, with a nice hot iron, the wrinkles come out effortlessly.
summary: Beautiful, but I have to iron it...

reviewText: I bought these for cloth wipes. They work great and are the perfect size for a wipe box.

I purchased this last week for my toddler (19 mo old) son. He absolutely LOVES it and it is a perfect size (maybe a tad big to grow into!), but light weight.  He had NO problem wearing it and it has adjustable straps, so it is easy to fit to him.  It has a couple pockets and cute banana zipper pulls.  It will be great for him to proudly carry a few of his own toys for our upcoming travels._________________________Follow up: Almost 2 years later and not a sign of wear. He doesn't use it all the time, but loves to stuff it full when he does. It is so cute and perfect for little ones. :)

Bought both this one and the Avent light green teether. The Avent one was my daughters all time favorite so I would definately get that one. This was her second favorite. She enjoyed all the different textures and the fact than it was bendable made it easier to manuver it where she wanted. Lightweight so she could hold it at an earlier age. The texture of the Avent one was the best. So my recommendation is to get both teethers so your baby has options for what they like that day to relieve the teething pains.

I loved the design for this blanket and when it arrived it was so soft. However, after the first wash it collected every piece of lint from the drier, and I had to lint brush it for an hour to make it kind of soft again. The second time I washed it I made sure there was nothing to deposit the lint, it still collected a ton of little pilled balls of lint. and wasn't even soft after I lint brushed it. I have several other minky blankets and have never had this problem with any of them. I am severely disappointed with my purchase.
summary: Cute but not very good quality

reviewText: Great product to keep all of your bath toys near and dry. Can't say more than GREAT product! Will recommend it to any one with small children.
This pillow was too small.  I'm 5'-4" and there was no way to make this comfortable.  I ended up returning it.

We received this highly priced product, flipped it over and were please to read "Made in USA", but right under that the tag reads 50% cotton, 50% polyethylene foam.Ahhh yes, don't you remember as child running through the wild fields of polyethylene? No? Neither do I.Polyethylene is a kind of thermoplastic-- wait! Plastic? Yup. They're trying to sell you "organic" plastic and charging a premium for the pleasure.I find it offensive that they have such contempt for organic seeking customers to pull this nonsense.The meeting surely went like this:"Green is big.""Really big.""We should get some of those green dollars.""But making green products is expensive.""Yeah, but hippies will pay anything for this stuff.""Well, what if we just call it "organic plastic"? That we can charge organic prices without all the trouble of making an actual organic product.""Brillant!""Green consumers sure are stupid."Everyone bursts into laughter.The level of cynicism it takes to market Polyethylene thermoplastic as organic for a product to be used on a newborn baby is beyond repulsive.Every single person at this company should be ashamed of themselves.

We decided to grab one of these instead of a bouncer chair so it would last her a bit longer. She really liked the toys and would hang out and try to pull them down, and even slept in it once. Around 7 or 8 months she kept trying to sit forward, so we had to take the toy bar down. Around 9 months, she started climbing into it, standing up and like... surfing in it. It's pretty dangerous around this age unsupervised, but she seems to love it so far.
It worked very well at the top of the stairs. Now that we've moved, we use it as a pet gate and it's awesome!
summary: we use it as a pet gate and it's awesome!

reviewText: Not only are these adorable... but my 16 month old daughter loves them!  She is so proud of herself when she stacks them up - the magnets really help make it "easier" to stack them.  This encourages her to continue to work on this new skill.  Regular blocks topple over much easier (especially on carpet) and she loses interest quickly.
These ring things were really and truly useless for us. The links went missing quickly and our daughter just wasn't interested in this toy...
summary: I didnt like them, baby wasnt very interested either

reviewText: I did tons of research on strollers in the past couple of weeks. My options were Bugaboo Bee, Mamas and Papas sola, JJ cole Broadway, Britax B ready and Uppababy Cruz.I ended up bought Bugaboo Bee since it's stylish and light. But it turned out has the following downsides: not easy to take out the seat, small basket, seat too low. I've always wanted a stroller with a higher seat so I returned it.I was very into JJ cole because the design of spinning the handle to change from rear facing to forward facing is so cool. But the negative reviews of it's poor quality and small seat area are really my concerns.I actually tried Mamas and Papa's Sola at a Babies R us store. It meets almost all my requirements but it just couldn't wow me.If I hadn't seen Uppababy I may have chosen Britax B-ready. But then I found Uppababy Cruz. I watched some videos about the stroller and fell in love with it. And today it arrived. With a very user friendly instruction I assembled it alone in just 5 minutes. So here are the pros and cons of this stroller:Pros:Easy to fold and unfold,Easy to take out and reverse the seat,Seat is higher than most of the strollers out there,Basket is vey big and easy to accessCons:Seat needs to be forward-facing to fold (while m&p; sola doesn't have to)Others: I hope the canopy is changeable like JJ Cole doesThere is no perfect stroller but I'm still satisfied with the purchase.
Pail keeps smells at bay. Foot pedal opens lid. Works well with our cloth diapers. Only wish it were slightly larger capacity.

I bought this stroller after purchasing the b-safe car seat. I live in Alaska and it's currently winter here, so I wasn't sure how often I'd actually use this to make a travel system since there's so much snow and it might have been more trouble than it was worth. Not the case!  This is SUPER easy to push and control, even in the snow, one-handed while I'm holding my 3 year olds hand!!!  I get so many compliments on this stroller and am so happy my husband convinced me to spend the extra $$$ so I can push my son around in his car seat via this stroller as opposed to hauling him around everywhere!  And did I mention the CRAZY EASY open and folding feature?!?!!  :-O a mothers dream!  If I could give this 10 stars, I would!
summary: Ecstatic about my sons new wheels!

reviewText: I love these canvases.  I was worried when I saw a customer photo that the colors would be different in person but they're not.  They look great and I'm excited to add them to my nursery.  I definitely recommend them.

I was able to find the original sheet at a local store, but paid more for it than on Amazon.  I thought I would receive the same sheet - but instead received the new design.  I don't like the new design nearly as much as the original.  It bunches up and doesn't snap at the ends like the original.  Not sure why they went to a poorer design but I wouldn't buy another one unless they added the end snaps.

Love these!!!  My son's nursery is absolutely precious with them... and they are very light canvas so I can hang them over his crib and won't be concerned if somehow they fell.  Easy to hang even with a thumbtack!  So cute!

This product comes completely set up in a box.  I did not have to do anything to it except put it in the car.  It's big, strong, and VERY LIGHT!  I highly recommend it.  In addition, my children can use it for 2.5 more years!

Installed in the back of Ford F-150 Crew cab. It came as advertised and is a nice size. I also liked how the slight opaqueness of the mirror keeps the sun out of little one's eyes.It was somewhat tricky to install on the back headrest simply because of the angle needed to be able to see little one in the rear view mirror. The seat backs in the F-150 are pretty tall. I ended up rolling a small dark hand towel to stuff behind the mirror in order to achieve the correct angle.
summary: As described but could be better

reviewText: This lasted a LONG time. Mix it with witch hazel, shake before spraying. It does have an herbal scent to it. So if that is not your thing then this product is not for you. It does clean reasonably well. I would hard a little more of this to the witch hazel than the label says and it seemed to clean better. You are better off to buy this and use your own bottle. If you just want a trial run, then get the 4 oz spray bottle.
summary: No wipes and didn't have to buy a new bottle for over two years!

reviewText: We transitioned our little one to the spout (and straw) type sippy cups (Gerber NUK brand mainly) a couple of months ago, the NUK sippy cups work great, spill-proof and leak-proof.We had the opportunity to try these and the concept seems great (and I can't think of a better concept), but the execution is a little poor.The "lip-activated lid" design really means a soft-flexible plastic piece is sandwiched between the water/fluid and the lip.  As you press on the "lid" it moves the plastic down and allows fluid to flow.  All other things constant, if you turn it upside down and do not touch the lid in anyway, no fluid comes out.In reality, once your little one figures out that when she presses on the lid when she's tipped the cup and fluid comes out, this will become a new game. :-)  Also, the drinking angle is a little awkward and though I don't have a way to measure flow it seems slower than a sippy cup (probably attributed to the drinking angle needed)Though the packaging states for 12months+, I think we might need to shelve these for a couple more months.I also took another star off because I've learned that even though you've assembled it the same way as you always have, to always test it by turning it upside down to see if it leaks before giving it to your little one.  One day I assembled it one way and then assembled it a different way and it leaked.  I took it all apart and reassembled it the very same way as the last time and then it didn't leak...who knows?  (I make sure the "Avent" label is readable from top when assembling and that seems to more consistently produce a leak free seal most of the time.)As we found with various sippy cup brands, you might be better off just buying a single one of these and just trying it, your results may vary greatly.  For us, we'll keep looking.  Actually, we've started to remove the rubber insert in sippy cups so it immediately flows so now she's learning she doesn't have to suck the fluid out, it will just flow out.  We think this will make for an easier transition to a traditional cup.  If anyone knows of a better "transition" type cup, please comment and let me know - my ears are open!
summary: Spill-proof, maybe, leak-proof...not for a 13 month old

reviewText: This is the only high chair that my husband and I have used for our 18-month-old daughter. When she first began eating solids, we loved it because this chair allowed her to eat right at the table with us. It also doesn't take up additional floor space, which is great.After nearly a year of use, though, we now hate this chair. Our daughter is a fairly non-messy eater, yet the hippos, the metal parts, and the chair itself are always laden with gross food particles. The few inch gap between the table and the edge of the chair means that loads of food falls on the floor at every meal. Super gross. It is also ridiculously difficult to remove the cloth fabric from the chair frame in order to wash it. Worst of all, the frame part that locks onto the table will no longer unlock! Even my (quite strong) husband cannot get this thing off the table. When we recently moved to a new home, we actually had to move with the stupid hippo chair still attached to the table.Like I said, we are still using the thing, but it's more because we can't get it off the table than any other reason. While it is really nice to not have the chair take up extra floor space, that's really the only benefit to this chair. If you were only to use it now and then while on the go (and if you could get it off the table again), then it might be worth considering this. But it is a real headache of a high chair if you want to use it for daily use. Unless you think cleaning food up from the hippos and the floor several times a day sounds like fun, and unless you savor the idea of having to wrestle the cloth part off of the frame... and the frame off of the table... then I really wouldn't recommend this chair. It may be durable and space-saving, but the extra mess and work created is really not worth it.

I never would have known about lap pads but for friends/family who gave them to us when our daughter was born.  We got these for expecting friends.  We still use them on the baby's changing pad for an extra layer of protection + sometimes in the crib if she goes through a phase of exceeding the diapers overnight ability.

I love these flash cards.  I have the sea, farm, and woodland sets.  My 8 week old son will stare at each card and study the different parts of the animal.  When he gets older, I look forward to talking with him about the animals. I highly recommend these!

We tried to use the cheapy one that comes with the carseat, but it just wasn't small enough for our newborn's head.  Get this one, and use both to start with.  He couldn't support his head on his own, but this was just the help he needed.  We didn't have to worry about his head bobbing around or falling forward nearly as often.  It's so easy to snap into the seat and you can just leave it in there for the next trip.  Even if you decide to get a different brand, at least get something to support baby's head.
Really liked this for our neutral colored nursery.  I wasn't sure what the texture was be and it really wasn't exactly what I was expecting but it looks nice.

I just received this cards in the mail and they have become an instant hit for my 3 month old. He loves starring at them with big wide eyes. I didn't expect them to be so thick, but considering my son immediately put one in his mouth as my husband tried to get him to grab it, it is a wise decision. I also purchased the mobile that can be used with these cards, but still haven't used it yet. Can't figure where to put it. Too many places I want him to see them. :) My only complaint is that I purchased the Jungle collection and it comes with a bear. Not very jungle like. Same goes for the Lion, but at least it fits better. I think I'll purchase the pet animals one next since we have cats.(Note: I also purchased these with the Look, Look books and the black and white animal book. I think now that I have them, I'd would rather have more of the flash cards because they are more versatile.)
summary: These cards make my babies eyes go big.

reviewText: I love diaper safari customer service. They are wonderful! These diapers are great for the cost that you pay. They are pretty thin and stretchy, and the elastic in the legs isn't as tight as other brands we have tried. But the snaps are very strong and they are worth the money we paid for them for sure! Great for starting a cloth diaper stash if you don't have very much cash to spend (like we did).

My daughter wants more for their baby. It keeps her neck dry when breast or bottle feeding and it is comfortable for mother and baby. I wish these were around when I had babies.  I hated the milk pooling around their necks.  A MUST for every baby.

I bought this when I noticed my 4 month old started to develop a flat head and was concerned about it getting any worse. My son is a big boy and he constantly was sliding out of this as the hole in the center is really small and the flap that hangs off wouldn't reach for him to be able to keep it under him. He'd squirm and there went the pillow and flap. I have noticed a slight difference in his head rounding out but I've been using over a month in addition to tummy time and all the other tricks to keep him off his back. I washed it and it faded and doesn't look as nice as when I first got it so a bit disappointed there. I have in all my research about products for flat head syndrome come across one not sold on Amazon, unfortunately! It's made by LazyLambert and sold on Etsy. You can get it custom made for about $20 in all sorts of fabrics and its much larger then this and the BabyMoon Pillow. My son is 6 months and at his wellness check up the doctor is giving his head another month to measure smaller or he's going to refer us to a specialist. I'm hoping my LazyLambert ErgoPillow does the trick as this did not. Perhaps from the beginning this would keep it from occurring in the first place but at 5-6 months this pillow is just too small.

I bought this to carry bottles of breastmilk.  I use the ~6oz bottles that came with my Medela breastpump.  I can make three bottles and an ice pack fit OK, but the narrow space at the top is somewhat wasted.  I find that it keeps things reasonable cold.  If I knew I was going to be without refrigeration for a while, I'd actually stuff the whole cooler in the freezer overnight and that definitely helped.  Now that my son is older and doesn't need as much milk, it will work well as a regular lunchbox.
summary: Keeps things nice and cool, holds three Medela bottles.

reviewText: We got these bottles as transitions from a bottle to a sippy cup. Daughter loved them and used with or without handles. Perfect!

I bought this for my son at bath time because the regular faucet doesn't reach his inflatable tub. Works great for that. Then I find out it works great for dogs. My one dog loves to drink out of the tub faucet, this makes it easier AND when I have to give the dogs a bath, it makes that easy too. Win, win and win.

I messed up with my cupboard length (make sure you measure before you purchase) but that was my fault so not blaming the product. It was sturdy and looked cute, quality was good for the price. Recommended!

I let him play with these in his highchair only, as he still crawls and rolls, and these would be painful for him if he rolled on them or crawled over them! But he likes to knock them over and chew on them! He loves the pictures and teaches him letters ( he is 9 months)

I purchased the Teethifier along with the Zoli stick gum massagers for my 15 month old, who is cutting his first set of molars. He never used a pacifier, so I wasn't sure how this would work for us. Honestly, he doesn't use either of the back-teeth teethers much, but before bed he'll chew on the Teethifier while we read books, and I leave it with him in his crib. Sometimes I find him chewing on it in the morning. It does make him drool a ton. He has not used the Zoli stick teethers more than a handful of times, and most of the time he turns it around and chews on the non-rubbery end. All in all, if your little one's molars seem to be bothersome, I would recommend the Teethifier.
summary: Teethifier vs. Zoli stick gum massager for first molars

reviewText: We like the Boon Flo simply because my 3 year old does not like to get her face wet. The water that flows from this successfully rinses out her hair without attempting to emerge her head into the bathtub water. She really likes when you put bubble bath in the Boon Flow and she gets bubbles! Well worth the purchase.

My daughter is 2 and we travel a bunch. This past March we headed to Florida and it was the first time that she really wasn't going to be happy in a pack and play so I bought this on Amazon and had it shipped to our destination and I couldn't; of been happier with it. There was no odor, it was packed well and it blew up in a minute. I went to target and bought a fun twin sheet and she took right to it on the first night. The side guards are not super tall but they do there job of "bumpering" the kiddo in there safely. When I asked her if she liked her bed and was it comfy she answered with a resounding "YES"!!  I look forward to using this in the future during our many adventure...Oh I did pack it back up into my suitcase, it weighs 6 pounds without the pump.

This bag is great, but it's super tiny. Don't believe the size above. I use Flip diapers and I can fit two full diapers in there or one cover and about 4-5 inserts. It's good for running errands but not much more. Also, if you leave wet diapers in there more than a few hours the bag will get damp on the outside.After washing though there is no smell.
