Worth every penny and I will be buying this for baby gifts! Every momma needs this convenient option. Nod it's cute so it's okay to leave on the kitchen counter all the time! ;)

We started using this when our son was about 3 months old because he was constantly getting his arms stuck between the slats on his crib.  We were careful to check its position each night and never had any trouble with it (used on a Pottery Barn crib).  We stopped using it when he was around 6 months because he started rolling over.
used for 9 months now and it still does great. requires new shields after about 6 months to keep up suction.

I have 12 washable, cotton pads of my own, though they are a different brand. I'm still breastfeeding at 14 months, and I can't imagine having to buy disposables all the time. You will have to wash 12 a few times a week when you first start breastfeeding, but now I only use breast pads for times of day that I know I tend to have leakages, and generally only use one pair per day.I bought these for a friend for her baby shower, because she preferred organic. She told me that she loves them, and is so glad she doesn't have to buy disposables at all. A must-have for women who plan to breastfeed.

I recently purchased the JL Childress Stroller Gate Check bag for a cross-country trip from Boston to Los Angeles. I had previously used theJL Childress Gate Check Bag for Car Seats, Redand experienced no quality issues so I decided to give the stroller bag a try.I considered some pricier options but wound up pulling the trigger on this bag since my previous experience was positive. This time was no different. We brought the bag in a carry on and put the stroller in it right before we boarded the plane. The bright red color makes it very easy to spot when you get off the plane and wait with all the other parents for the gate-checked bags. Again, no issues with tearing (on both initial and return flights) so I definitely got my money's worth. It even has a handle which some of the airport employees commented was very convenient. I imagine the bag is less likely to get thrown around (and potentially damaged) if its easy to carry and move around.I have another trip to Florida in a few months so we'll see how it holds up the second time around!

All of my friend who had babies before me had this carrier and raved about it, and when I got pregnant, it was the one specific baby item I knew I wanted. We used it with the infant insert (which I've also reviewed) from 5 pounds (this is one of the only carriers rated for that low weight). We have walked all day with it with no complaints on a 4-day and 6-day trip so far. By the end of the day our baby is sometimes fussy in it, but at the end of a long travel day, anyone can be fussy! For the most part, she sleeps comfortably and happily in it most of the day (these days she is more awake and alert in it). The waist belt for added support sets it apart from every other baby carrier. Our baby is 3 months old and 12 pounds now, but I know we will be able to use this carrier comfortable for much longer (over a year, over 20 pounds, etc... based on what my friends with older babies have been able to do).

I agonized over buying this stroller for over a year.  When we decided to have another baby I finally did it, and I am so glad I did.  I have a 3 year old and almost 2 year old and they love riding in this on our nightly walks.  It is easy to push, fold, and add/remove the second seat. It may be a bit bulky in the back of our SUV but I pop off the wheels (easy) and it helps save some room.  We are very happy with this stroller.
Totally love! Absorbs so much (for a reflux baby that's saying a lot!), cute print, large enough to only need one per feeding! Bought the girl ones as well!

Since my tot was constantly chewing on his pacifier instead of sucking it, I thought this would be the perfect solution.  Right now (4 1/2 months) he isn't totally into it, but I think when he gets a little more hand eye coordination down he will enjoy it more.  For the price I think this is a great buy and worth a try - if the baby doesn't like it, you are only out a few bucks.
summary: Seems cool, but baby isn't that into it yet

reviewText: Because he can fit the legs in the mouth. I waited on ordering this because of the bad reviews about the legs being dangerous but decided I'd try it and just watch him. I don't see any safety issues. My son likes this because he can easily get the legs into his mouth, and the back where he wants to chew.
summary: the only toy that doesn't frustrate my 6month old

reviewText: I liked these gum massagers because the design, which prevents little ones from gagging. My 18 month old likes his, but they are not as big of a hit as I expected. The texture is ribbed rubber and very gentile.
summary: Nice to hand to your teething child

reviewText: The 2 items are very cute but don't serve the purpose! Neither popsicles nor Gogurt tubes could be in it no matter how soft & they are! Frustrating! Don't worth to return so I keep them! 2 stars for the look!
summary: Very cute but don't serve the purpose!

reviewText: this did keep my son from getting his legs and arms stuck through the bars, but it's not very sturdy in terms of the installation. Basically as soon as your little one is old enough to put a hand on it, they can just pull it down. so it doesn't really protect him from bonking his head against the bars of his crib.

I bought this for my three year old when he transitioned to a twin size bed. It's a little awkward in his platform bed but I just position the rails on the wooden slats and the weight of the mattress holds it in place. I've been really happy with this so far and it wasn't hard to install.
summary: Works on a Pottery Barn Kids Platform Bed

reviewText: Have used these since day one and they stay on our Subaru Outback back windows just fine.  You do need to keep them in mind when rolling the windows down, but even if they do fall off they are easy to get back on.  They don't cover the entire window, but cover a good enough area that you can adjust them to work for your baby and we are very happy with the quality and effectiveness.
somehow it is a bit tricky to fold...otherwise, it works great!We use it for high chairs in the restaurant!easy to wash!

We received the item, but the item itself does not seem waterproof. The underside does not seem to have any type of sealed backing and it looks that any type of liquid would nonetheless seep through the pad.I wouldn't recommend it.
I like the cover it just bunches up. But  it does the job by not leaking just doesn't sit well on my baby.

My daughter can no longer get into our closets and pull everything out! These sit along the top of the closet doors and slide very easily back and forth as I need to get into the closets. I am a very short person 5' tall. These are still easy for me to reach. Love this product!!!

My almost 5 month old puts EVERYTHING in her mouth so when I decided to get her some 6 month developmental toys I had to put this on the list.  It's so cute!  We just got it today and I put her with a bunch of new toys and this entertained her for a good while before it fell away from her and she found something else to play with.  I know we will get lots of use out of it.  She usually has a light blanket in her carrier and this will be a great replacement for it and a lot more fun.

This is perfect for my 5 month old grandson to use when he goes to sleep at night. His arms are free but he can't maneuver his legs so that they wind up between the slats of the crib. The material is comfortable, and this is very easy to take on and off. This is much safer and effective than a standard blanket since there is no chance of your child kicking it off or having a blanket wind up covering their face.

We needed to fit 3 car seats in the back of our Atlima so after many countless hours of research, I stumbled across this product. I love the fact that it is lightweight and doesn't take up a lot of room. This is perfect size for our 7 year old. The only thing is it's a bit difficult for my son to fit the seatbelt into the red loop, but it's not a big deal.

My son loves this teether! I call it his "razzle dazzle berry" and he gets so excited when it's in front of him. Although, I'm not positive, I think that it has actually weaned him from his regular binky. He loves to chew on all of them now and isn't interested in sucking them. I know a lot of parents want to wean their kids of the binky, but I wasn't ready for that since he needs to suck to sleep. Like I said, I can't say it was this teether, but it did happen shortly after he started chewing it.
Great paci clip. It clips on very secure and baby can't pull off like other clips. A little shorter which is nice for sleeping.Bright, pretty colors.

I never used an amber necklace for my older daughter, but for my newborn who started teething a month ago, I have used the amber necklace. I wasn't sure if it was really doing anything, and on day forgot to put it back on her after we went to the doctor. Then, I noticed she was much fussier and harder to console for a few days. I remembered the necklace, put it on her before bed, and by the next day, her demeanor was much calmer. I don't take it off her anymore!

I love these bibs. They are soft and work great for drool and spit-up. I am mostly leaving this review to help you with sizing. These are small and fit my 2 month old son perfectly right now. He is about 13 pounds but is long and lean. I feel like they might not fit in a in a few months. I don't feel like they will fit chubby babies when then need them the most.Update: My son is almost 6 months old and these still fit wonderfully. I'm ordering more!
summary: Great Bibs! - one star for no sizing as sold here

reviewText: This is the only toy which can soothe my now 4 month old. She has been listening to its tunes since she was 2 weeks old.The melodies are so soothing that they instantly make her stop crying and more often than not she falls asleep listening to its tunes.It's a life saver during those fussy days!!! don't know what I would have done without this toy.

My daughter is 3 months old and LOVES this! I use it in the bathtub inside her baby bathtub and fill the "big" tub with warm water. She feels secure and comfortable. Only thing is you have to splash a bit of water on the already wet surface so it doesn't get cold.

For whatever reason, I own a multitude of different brands of wipes.  I have Kissaluvs, Baby Kicks, GMD, Imse Vimse, Charlie Banana and made by a WAHM.Out of all of the wipes, these are the softest by far.  They would be perfect for a newborn!  They are a very lightweight jersey material.  They feel somewhat like a cut up t-shirt.  When they were first purchased, they repelled water more than my other wipes - so they did need a few goes in the wash to become as absorbent as the others.  It wasn't a big deal or anything.  I just wanted to warn people.As far as cleaning a substantial amount of poo - I don't think they're really cut out for the job.  They lack texture and are really too soft.  I like Kissaluvs for the extreme jobs and Baby Kicks or GMD wipes for the moderate ones.  Charlie Banana wipes are better suited for cleaning delicate areas without causing irritation - or for when changing a wet diaper.They hold up nicely in the wash.  The ends don't ravel apart or catch onto velcro (like Imse Vimse wipes do) and while they are a little more prone to staining than the other wipes - the staining eventually washes out after they've gone through a few wash cycles and/or have been hung outside in the sun.
Sad its a bit small but its cute nonetheless and my niece absolutely goes crazy over it. Not a bad purchase.

This chair came in handy when my 16 month old daughter started refusing to get in her high chair for meals.  She was ready to sit with us at the "big table" but was too small to sit in the chair and reach the table.  She has no problem using this chair.  It's all plastic, so not soft and cushy, but that doesn't bother her.  It's very easy to clean.  Also, the back is adjustable so it's easy to have the child sit close to the table and scoot it back as they grow.  Good seat for a good price!

I've been using these since day 1 on my 7 lb newborn girl in combination with green mountain diaper nb prefolds and a snappi. We haven't had a single leak and it fits perfectly over the diaper. I prefer velcro to snaps.

I ordered this because my baby was having problems with the Beco carrier we had.  She fussed every time we put her in it.  So I thought I would try this.  Personally, I thought it was hard to get the hang of and hard to get my baby in comfortably.  She started to like the Beco after awhile and I stopped using this.

We love this booster seat!  My 2 year old daughter is able to easily get in and out of it, and the straps are simple enough that she can even buckle herself in; although not so simple that she can unbuckle herself and escape!  I haven't had to remove the straps to wash them yet, but when it is time to they look to be extremely simple to remove.  My favorite feature is that the backrest can be positioned so that she has back support as she grows.  In my opinion, this is the best booster seat on the market.  Good job Graco!UPDATE 4/26/14:  Still love this product, so much so that I bought another one for my son who has now outgrown the high chair.  In my opinion, this is the best booster seat on the market, and I don't know why everybody doesn't own this one.

I love wearing my baby, he snuggles so well. I had a pouch style sling when he was a newborn and liked it so well that I ordered this Moby because I had heard such rave reviews on them, I personally didn't really like this type of wrap, it's hot and takes a lot of practice and patience. it helps to watch YouTube videos and have help to get it just right, but my little guy didn't ever really like this as much as the pouch sling or the ring style sling is my favorite and it's quick and lighter and he still enjoys being in them at 7 months old, but won't let me put him in the Moby without him screaming and wiggling to be free!I ended up giving the Moby to a friend with a new baby for her to try to see if she likes it.
I purchased this booster seat because it looks so easy to clean, and it is. The seat back removes and there are no seatbelt holes in the crotch area to catch food.
Easy to clean, great booster. Son uses it without issues.  Only thing is, I wish I could raise the crotch strap higher.  Seems VERY tight - but I guess that's a good thing!
summary: Great booster, only wish strap were MORE adjustable

reviewText: This is a great crib.  We ordered 2, one for my 9 month old and one for the one on the way in a couple of months.  It's is incredible sturdy and well made.  Easy to put together and exactally the color we were looking for.  I was pleasently surprised by the quality given the cost.Only issue we discovered a few days ago is since my daughter is teething, her sharp little teeth scratch the surface of the wood and leaves marks if she chews on the edge.  Not sure if this is an issue for all wooden cribs.

We wanted to co-sleep with our baby, but knew would sometimes not want her in our bed.  This co-sleeper is a nice compromise between a separate crib/bassinet and always having the baby in your bed.  It is so easy to reach over to soothe her, talk to her, or pick her up and bring her into bed or vice versa.  It also gives baby some practice sleeping on her own before we move her to a crib.
i would not recommend this for babies who spit-up frequently, because it will end up all over your chest! it is also a ton of material for me (5 ft tall) and very hot.
This tub does the job. It fits in my two side kitchen sink well. The infant insert is not very good, but we had a hand me down tub insert that we used instead.

i bought this pacifier because we spent $10-15 on smoothies in the first two weeks of daycares.  Mutliple babies had the same smoothie, and we never got ours back.  Traditional smoothies are hard to label and hard to catch from being dropped.  These little animals fix all those problems.  We just throught the elephant (smoothie and all) into the washing machine once a week.  I was reluctant to pay this kind of money for a pacifier but it is one of our favorite baby products, and it is most definately the baby's favorite product!  She holds on to it and can find it at night if she looses it!  You could make your own by just sewing a small something to the end of the pacifier but this is the perfect size.  Plus everyone comments on how adorable it is.  We also have the giraffe. personally, i prefer the giraffe.

These are the BEST Burp rags EVER! First off, they are super soft and wash up nicely.  They are extra think in the middle so it does take a little longer in the dryer to dry completely.  I have been using them since my son was a newborn.  Used them on my shoulder so he would have a nice soft place to lie his head. As he got older, I used them for burp cloths as they hold A LOT! He didn't spit up much but when he did, they did the job! Now, 11 months later, these are his "rag".  He likes one to go to bed with and uses it as a security blanket.  I have 2 dozen and he loves them all the same! Great product! Great purchase!
summary: These are the BEST burp rags EVER!

reviewText: My son loves these!  His preschool gives them out to kids routinely and knobby is particularly great for those hard to reach molars as they come in.  Easy to clean, too.

The sparkly green/blue of this potty chair reminds me a car...my niece enjoys it...she said she can speed like her mom...lol...it is well made and easy to clean...the chair arrived well packed and in good condition
My 4 year old son picked this out.  It is as it is described. I like that it is still pliable when frozen instead of being rock hard.  Doesn't hold coldness long though.

My son was small for his age for the first few months, but this swing was perfect for him.  He would watch us do housework or sleep...  By the time he weighed 16lbs though, it wouldn't rock fast enough to keep him happy and he kept trying to crawl out.

I was happy to see clear toothpaste come out of the tube when I purchased this product!!  The toothbrush is pretty stiff-better for a mouth full of teeth but we LOVE the toothpaste.  Worth it just for that.  My son only has four teeth so we're still using our rubber bristle toothbrush but the handle on this one is easy to hold and will be great when he gets a little older.

I rarely write truly one-star reviews, but this one I just had to - and I have been meaning to for months.I bought three different kinds of waterproof bibs for my one-year old.  Meal time has been getting messier and I wanted a pocket.  All three products suggested that I hand-wash the bib.  REALLY?!  What Mom has time for that?Anyway, regardless, I tried to keep them all out of the washer.  But, I have a husband.  And, I love my husband very much.  But, he most certainly was not attentive to the fact that the bibs need to be kept out the washer.Both other products held up perfectly fine in the washer - and three months later, they continue to.  So, i appreciate them telling me that the product would be better if I handwashed it, but at the end of the day, they produce a quality waterproof bib that is still in rotation at our household. Even going through the washer on a regular basis and, gulp, sometimes even the dryer.These Neat Solutions barely made it two weeks and one washing and they turned to garbage.  Sadly.So, I recommend the Luvable Friends Baby Bib with Waterproof backing or the Bumkins waterproof super bib.

I like that these are flushable, and they are very soft!  I feel like they are comfortable on my baby's bottom.  The only thing I don't like is that they stick to his bottom when wet, so I have to peel them off, which is annoying.

These run a little larger than other one size diapers, I was looking for something in between a fuzzi bunz one size, and the perfect size large, and these are just perfect!! I will certainly get a few more of these to round out our diaper supply. I also like the cute prints!No leaks, no red marks. Happy toddler, happy parents.
summary: These run a little bigger than other one size diapers :)

reviewText: Pros:* The dimensions of the placemat is 17.5 x 12 - I just mention that because I didn't see it in the description above.* There is adhesive on all 4 sides.  I bought a pack of these from a local store, and they only had adhesive on 2 sides.  This is a nice option if you need all 4 sides.  Also, the adhesive is fairly sticky - but my 13 month old can pull it up when she wants to!* Nice bright colors!* Competitive price.  I saw a count of 20 at a local store for half this price...so you get @ 10 more placemats for the price when you buy the lot of 50.* Pop up dispenser is nice but a little bulky.  I think the measurements on the Amazon description page must allude to this box...its roughly 8x5x2.  I didn't receive a resealable bag...I did when I bought them locally with no pop up box.  The resealable bag is nice if you only need a couple and you have a small bag.  The pop up box makes it easier/faster to open/close.* These are plastic and I don't believe you can decorate them if you wanted.  Instead, you could bring a coloring page (or get one from the restaurant) and color on top of this one, then eat off of this plastic one.Cons:* The only tricky thing is getting the place mat down with the adhesive part exposed when your child is grabbing or batting at it.  Its no big deal.* I don't know if this is a "con" or not, but I only got the "blue" place mats even though the picture also shows yellow.I've had several people in public comment on the great idea and ask where to get them.I recommend this product - I've reloaded!
summary: Handy item for on the go feedings

reviewText: My baby really loves this little ball. He loves trying to get ahold of the little ball inside and also loves shaking it with his hands and hearing the rattle. Over alll, a good product

I bought this for my son bc I found it super cute. It looks great in his room, and now at 11months old, he can hold the comb and brush himself, and when I tell him to brush his hair, he does it! He actually has a great time playing with these while I change him, since he's at the age where he wants nothing to do with laying still on his back for a diaper change... they are a great distraction! This would make a great gift and is a product that will really grow with your child. I don't use the mirror function yet, but sure we will as he gets older.

It seems like if you add "baby" or "wedding" to anything the price gets jacked up even if it does the same thing or less than something without that in the title.  This camera is no different.  I have 3 other types of ip cameras - Foscam, Panasonic, and Motorola.  They all do basically the same thing, but vary vastly in price.  This dlink and the Motorola have lullabies and a temperature sensor, but those are the only added features, but both are priced more than the others.  This dlink also does not do pan & tilt, so it has even less capability than the others.  I find it difficult to get the camera to set in just the right position because the power cord gets in the way and will pull it out of sorts if not adjusted right.The only added thing that I do like on the dlink is that you can put in a microSD card and it will record automatically with sound or motion.  Instead of needing added software through a computer, it does it all standalone.I'm a big fan of Foscam and they are the cheapest option that I have, but they are a little more complicated to install for use outside of your network.  The Panasonic & Motorola are both super easy to install with the Pansonic being the cheaper option.Overall, this is an okay camera with a good picture, but with little adjustment capability.  There are other options that are more flexible and cheaper.

This monitor was such a pleasant surprise. It is easy to use and has many features of more expensive monitors. The viewing span is quite good (we can see almost all of my son's bedroom), and the quality is surprisingly good. I recommend spending the extra $50 for this one, versus those at the next level down ... it is excellent quality, user-friendly, and actually an incredible value. We have not used the "record" feature yet, but seems straight forward. As other reviewers are saying, the volume is a little low -- even at its highest level -- but just adequate. I would suggest to the manufacturer to increase volume capabilities just a bit. Overall, we are very happy with it and highly recommend.

Bought one of these antd I loveeeee it. The size is great and the quality. I got exactly what was in the pic. It is very soft but I thought it would have been a bit thicker, but that's okay, this can work for me. I wished they had different colours with the same bear so I can order more. I will be ordering my rest of blankets in the future from Cater Brand

This thing was honestly a life saver it kept my son entertained while I was able to do dishes or go to the bathroom. It lights up, has music and makes animal noises. Only problem is that my son has been growing like crazy and weighed too much for it, so we only got to use it for a short time. If you have a smaller house it may not be the best idea it does not break down at all another disadvantage about it. But it is awesome, he loved flipping the pages on the little book and watching it light up and make different animal noises. he loved bouncing up and down and trying to reach the monkey and the lion and the giraffe. he loved looking at himself in the little mirror and playing with the elephants big ears. I love how the seat swiveled around easily so he could look at whatever he wanted to. I also appreciate how easy it was to clean.
summary: love it wish we could have used it more

reviewText: I put these on my registry, and tried them out.  The baby couldnt figure these out, and just got frustrated.  They were ridiculous to clean.  I went on to try Tommee Tippee (only sold at BrU, fyi) and they were perfect.  We are a Tommee Tippee family, now.
This a good device for the price but my 2 yr old does not want anything on her head so I can't use it. But its a good fit and works great.

I received this as a gift and would highly recommend it for newborns. It's definitely more about comforting than entertaining. The fabric is very soft and the seat is very deep and enveloping compared to most bouncers. It does bounce if baby gets energetic, but not on its own, however you can bounce it gently yourself with very little effort. It has a volume control for the music (soothing melodies) and sound effects (rain, water and something which sounds like a heartbeat) and a gentle vibration feature. The structure seems very stable and I can't imagine it could tip easily, if at all. I have mostly used it for my little one to nap in during the day (never unattended). The heartbeat sound particularly seems very soothing for her and she's able to snuggle down in the seat like she would in my arms. It allows me to put her down somewhere comforting for an hour and keep an eye on her so I can get a few things done, or sit down for a minute. I do wish the sound would go on a little longer - it shuts off after about ten minutes to save battery power - but other than that I wouldn't change a thing.Edited 3/3/2008 to add: My daughter is now 7 months old and we still use this every day. She doesn't sleep in it any more but uses it like a chair (it has two settings, reclining and upright). It has enough room for a few toys of her own, and she recently discovered the toy bar and loves the little bug, which she can now pull off with a bit of work. Now she's older she enjoys the music though we still use the heartbeat sound for background if she's having trouble dozing off for her nap. Also, in 7 months we have NEVER had to change the batteries. This bouncer really has been great and I'll be very sad when she grows out of it.
My baby loved it.. several songs with all that colourful lights. Cheap and small. classic songs that makes the baby pay a lot of attention.

They do seem to work a little better than Gerbers training pants.  Gerbers seem to hold a small trickle, while the Imse Vimse pants will temporarily hold in a full accident.  While I found Gerbers to be perfectly adequate for my first two children, my youngest tends to be so absorbed in her play that she sometimes misses her body's cues.That being said, if you are looking for something that will hold in a full accident for any extended length of time - these are NOT what you are looking for.  These will resist leaking long enough for you to remove them before they soak your child's clothing.  (Once you see that "look" in your toddler's eye - you'll have maybe a minute or two.)They are not for bedwetting, will not keep a car seat dry, etc, etc, etc.  These are for children who are beginning to show some bladder and bowel control.As for their design - they are very soft and I'd imagine are comfy.  The sizing is accurate.  They hold up well in the wash.  My daughter was so excited to wear these and wants them to stay dry as she loves wearing "real underwear" with animals on it.
summary: Cute, comfy and prevents puddles on the floor

reviewText: We have a small bathroom so I was a little worried how this would fit in there without getting in the way, but it fits great. My toddler loves to go & sit on it & at 18 months has already did 1 & 2 in it! It's a wonderful simple design that makes it super easy to clean. Love the green color, I think the picture displays the color accurately on my computer.
I bought these for my son when he was 9 months old.  He loves them. The little nobs are great for baby hands to grip a ball much easier.  He is one and a half now and they are still his favorite.
It is the best toy ever!!! my beby loves it, I cannot take her out of home without her Baby Einstein take along tunes. The music is relaxing, she cal also bite the toy, easy to hold, perfect!

Initially we bought our new little daughter a simple green bouncy seat that has some "spring" to it when you push it back but we returned that one quickly because our little one was so bored with it so quickly and didn't like sitting in it. I'll mention some reasons below that we really like this seat.Assembly: this was very easy, the cloth fit over it perfectly, and the toy/accessory snapped into place without problem.Recline Mode: If you look at the photo, you will notice that toward the front at the bottom there is a bar that goes from side to side. This is a "kick stand" that can be pulled down to lock the seat into a sturdy reclining mode which also prevents the rocking. It made such a huge difference for her to lay in a reclined position, especially if she's taking a short nap, it added at least another hour of well needed rest. Additionally its nice to let them lay back as they can't support their neck very well early on. The rocking position however is very nice when she is in a playful mood.Seat adjustment: Not only does this allow a stabilized reclining position, but the back of the seat itself is also adjustable, although not by much. You push the two large green buttons on the sides at the same time and the back can move one unit forward or one unit back. What I don't like about this is that if your using both hands already to push the buttons in, how do you move the back of the seat at the same time to position it ? Well somehow I'm able to get it but kinda strange, should have it only on one side to free up one of your hands. We use mostly the reclined position when thinking to change posture.Toy: comes with a nice attachment with toys that suspend from above that your little one can play with. It also has a little handle that when she pulls it, a short song is played. This helps her learn cause and effect.Vibration Mode: The seat does have a similar button that allows the seat to vibrate. I don't know why but this calms them down and gets them to sleep quickly. She loves it.Cloth: The cloth is very easy to remove and wash. This is super important as you can imagine. It also has the usual safety straps (seat belt) built in to secure your child.Mobility: The seat is not that heavy and easy to lift. You can also slide or push it easily across the carpet to move it however note that you cannot do this while its in the stabilized reclining position because the white rubber at the bottom prevents this.Overall: This is a great seat. We returned the previous one that we purchased which was slightly smaller and only had a little bit of a bouncy/springy effect and purchased this one instead. The quality and features on this one make it way better and if you have tried other seats, i'm sure you'll understand why.Happy shopping for your little one,George

The book is nice and the workmanship seems pretty good. Each of the pieces that are attached well and they make noises either krinkly, or rattly, or whatever. We like it and feel it was worth while.On the downside there's just a few minor things to mention. Our 6-month-old is only barely interested in it sometimes and would rather play with other toys. He liked the box it came it much more than the book itself (Isn't that what always happens?). There are some annoying yellow strings that hang off it all over the place for attaching it to a crib and they just get in the way. Also the pieces don't stay in the openings made for them very well. You can barely get the pieces in and then they fall out immediately.
The clutch is a perfect addition.  Wanted the clutch for quick trips, but didn't want to pay extra.  This bag comes with it!!!  Nice design even the hubby will carry.
We have two of these - they're great. I don't care about the little arm and hammer thing.. but it's nice that there's no weird padding or whatever to get pee in it. Just sleek and wipeable.

My infant daughter enjoys playing with this for a short period of time.  She often goes back to it throughout the course of the day.  I would recommend this purchase as she has been able to use it for several months thus far.
My son is 10 months old and still uses this. He's just so comfy in it.  I think this is a must have.
This is the first toy my little guy has played with. It's perfect for his little hands to grasp, and it keeps him entertained and curious.

I purchased this for my daughter. She had researched and most of the carriers were a lot more money than this one.  The features matched in comparison and it supported the need. She is able to wash the dishes or run the vacuum or take a walk and feel that her baby is supported and comfortable.

reviewerName: Getting Used to Being a Mom "GUBM"
reviewText: One minor complaint--the little section for rinse water is MUCH too small.  I think it barely holds 2 cups of water!  I don't use it--I just put a big pitcher of water to the side of the tub and pour it over the baby's body in order to rinse him well.

I use disposables when I go out with the baby, but still wanted a reusable wet bag to carry baby clothes and burp cloths that get dirty. I bought these Kushies bags because they were the least expensive I could find.Don't expect a heavy-duty wet bag at this price. But these work nicely for me. The drawstring on the large bag is held closed securely by a plastic grip. I've already machine-washed these bags a few times, and they came out perfect. It also folds up very small, and takes up no room, so it's perfect for storing in a smaller changing kit. I use the little bag for pacifiers, because I don't like them rolling around loose in my bag. I'm planning to get a second set in a different color.

This stroller was purchased to use at our beach holiday as it was cheap and cheerful and it didn't matter if it got corroded by the salt water and sand.  We were going to leave it behind after our 3 weeks at the beach, however it turned out to be much nicer and more comfortable than expected so we brought it home to use as teh spare strolle at Grandma's house.  Baby loves it
Great set. Comes in different sizes. They are easy to clean. Convenient for pumpimg or on the go moms. Super and for the value, I highly recommend.
summary: Great Starter for New Mom or as Gift

reviewText: The front side (one with design) is a little rough but the back side is soft. These aren't very thick but that makes them great for getting between your little one's leg and arm rolls. :-P

best gate for baby or dog gate, I bought this one and the extension becauseI have a long space area that wanted to protect from a puppy and a baby and this is perfect. easy to install and not bad on the price. very happy

I really don't like giving gifts for new babies that will only be used for a really short period of time - like clothes.  This set can be used for well over the first year.  The wipe container and the holder that would allow you to hang shopping bags on a stroller, can be used early in the new one's life.  The spoon, sippy cup, and snack cup will come into play a little further into the first year, but will be used well past that first birthday.  I have many OXO items in my kitchen and I am sure these baby items will be of a similar quality.

My dd is now 5 months old and we are still using this tub.  I wasn't sure I would get a baby tub b/c a friend said she only used hers twice.  Well, I'm glad I did!  I selected this one after reading online reviews.  It fits nicely in our kitchen sink which puts it at a good heighth to avoid back strain.  It is nice sturdy plastic with no leaking (as fold up ones do), and no mildew on pads.  The infant side has a little curve to it, so if baby splashes the water just rolls to the other side of tub, not out.  The drain is very nice to have in the bottom, plus it turns white if water is too hot.  The sling was great for sponge baths in the beginning, it really cradles baby so YOU feel better.  I haven't used the toddler side yet b/c she can sit up, but I think she may outgrow it before I can do that anyway.

We just retired this after 4 months of use. Our baby has outgrown it and stopped sleeping when we try to put him in it. But for your reference, he is 97th percentile height, so although he is not yet rolling or mobile at all, he just seemed to be getting uncomfortable with his arms constantly hitting the sides and waking him.What I loved:- How secure I felt he was in it. We attached it to our bed from day one, I couldn't imagine not doing so.- It is a sturdy product. We just finished using it constantly for our big, heavy baby and are storing it in case he has a sibling in future. I am confident that it will last though another and beyond.- Having him in his own space right next to me so I could respond & soothe him quickly. So, so convenient for night nursing and just a really lovely way to get used to having a new baby.- The handy pockets at either end for diaper supplies etc- Space for storage underneathWhat was less than ideal:Though advertised as such, this is not something you would likely travel with. It is easy to put up, but it is a total pain to take down and it's heavy. Another post mentioned the release buttons, they are indeed tricky so unlikely something you would want to battle with on a regular basis.I would have liked something that was a bit more appealing to look at, this is not a pretty piece of furniture.Overall I LOVED having this co-sleeper. It was exactly what I wanted for my baby and me and it did the job wonderfully well. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is I thought it did not quite live up to the advertised portability. But it was perfect for our family.

I really like these for several different uses, not just in the bassinet. We use them just about anywhere to keep baby clean (like when he's relaxing on the floor) or to keep furniture clean (in case of diaper blow out). Haven't had any problems with washing.

Perfect size for toddler2 parts so no complicated set up (The bowl & seat)No small nooks or crannies that can build up moldDurable plasticPortableEasy clean upConCan potentially slide easily along floorCan also potentially be flipped over by toddler if not careful

I bought this for our third baby. We have 2 very active little boys who are 3 and 5 and we added a girl to our brood.  We bought a Balboa Baby Sling and really liked it, but it was harder on me than my husband.  I am "shorter than average" at 5'2", but have a short torso even for my height.  This has always presented a challenge for slings because I am *ahem* top heavy, as well.  HotSlings and other pocket slings never worked - by the time I found one that could acomodate my chest, our daughter was hanging at my thighs and wasn't secure.  I loved the Balboa baby carrier, but even on the shortest setting, it put a lot of the baby's weight on my lower back.  With the Moby wrap, you wrap it to fit YOU, so it's always the right size.  My husband is 9 inches taller than I am and he can wear it, take it off, and hand it to me.  I just re-wrap it.  There are no "but I just got it to the perfect size" moments, which I LOVE.  I perfected 3 carries in about 20 minutes with our 6 month old.  I will add that 1.) I had already gotten used to different carries with our Balboa sling; 2.) our baby has been worn since she was born, so she was very patient and actually seemed excited once we started trying the wrap styles with her; 3.) I did it right after she has nursed when we didn't need to go anywhere, so there was no pressure to hurry up and figure it out.  I can see where it may look daunting, but seriously, I am clumsy and a perfectionist, and I felt very comfortable after going to the Moby website and getting instructions on wraps and holds.  Because you can smooth the fabric out across your back, the weight distribution is AMAZING.  I wish they would invest something like this for pregnancy!  I don't feel any "tugging" on my shoulders, or that dull ache in my lower back.  It's really nifty.It *is* a bit warm, but honestly, you're baby-wearing.  Babies are like little furnaces.  You're only going to get so much air, right?All in all, I love this thing.  It IS just a long stretchy piece of fabric, but it's made grocery shopping, taking walks, chaotic fundraising events at Chuck E. Cheese, and just about every thing else a bit easier.  I am probably going to buy another one just so I can ALWAYS have one ready in the event of diaper blow-out or other childhood-associated catastrophe.  :-)
So cute and really well made! No blowouts or leaks! I use with my prefolds... and they're really adjustable which is nice

The description does state this will fit two pacifiers, but it really depends on their size.  I have regular pacifiers with the plastic shield and Avent Soothies, and the Soothies were the only ones where I could cram two of them in there.  For regular pacifiers with the plastic shield you can only fit one.  That's not such a problem for me, but the description really should be a bit more accurate.  The pacifiers I have are the newborn size, so if you get a bigger pacifier there's even less space for it.  On the plus side, it does seem to lock pretty well.  I did have trouble opening it from the tab at the top; a work around it so just squeeze the sides and it pops right open.  It has an open side on the clip, which allows you to easily attach it to something.  I also bought the NUK carrier, and it's pretty much the same thing (just more expensive).  Size wise, it also only fits one pacifier so if you're looking for something to fit two pacifiers, you will need to keep looking (or just use a Ziploc bag).

My little one was tired of her standard high chair, so I invested in this seat for our table.  I love it!ProsGood unisex colorEasy to wipe cleanFastens securely to tableSeat fasteners keep my baby strapped in safelySeems comfyConsHad to buy a new table for this chair.  No glass top tables!I haven't had the chair very long, and my baby is still only 22 pounds, so I will update once the weight increases on the chair.  So far, so good.

Our baby loves the sound of the music, it soothes her and whenever she is fuzzing about going to sleep it helps her fall asleep. She also loves to look at the lights, but even when she doesn't look at the lights she is still entertained by it. She hates tummy time, but when i provide her this toy, she almost forgets that. I have to say that we even love the 7 songs and i also believe them to be the perfect length, some of the fisher price toys have songs that i believe are too short.

We stuff these behind the microfiber insert in our baby's pocket diapers. He's a super heavy wetter but his diapers are thick enough as it is so we don't want to make them any more ridiculous looking than they already are. These are nice and trim and we've had no leaks with this combo.
summary: super trim and works awesome as a doubler

reviewText: Great design!  Love the continuous bag that reduces waste and gives us control over when to empty.  Trap door keeps odors at bay and sleek design looks great in the nursery.  Got it right on my first try.  If you are a new mom trying to figure out what diaper pale to get, look no further.  This one will serve you well!
summary: Best diaper pale.. A must have

reviewText: My toddler loves using this potty seat.  They have the exact same one at her day care, which made it easy to convince her to use it at home.  She insisted on using her toy potty chair for several months when we just began potty training, but I got tired of cleaning it out every time she used it, so one day the chair just disappeared and she only had her seat.  Since then, she's used the seat without complaint.  She likes having the handles to hold on to, and it fits my elongated toilet seat just fine.  The only complaint I have is that the underside of the seat has some sort of plastic gridlike framework underneath that always manages to get pee on it.  I just wish the underside was smooth so it was easy to wipe down underneath, so I just rinse it off in the tub when it gets gross.  Otherwise it's perfect!  We have two, one for each bathroom.  I also installed little Command hooks on the wall by the toilet to have a space to hang it when it's not in use (grown ups need the potty too!) so it doesn't just lay on the floor.
summary: Fits great and works well, but gets gross underneath

reviewText: In person, this rocker is just as bright and colorful as in the picture. After looking at a couple older infant-to-rocker models, it is clear that Fisher Price found a way to further increase the stability of the rocker in the front. They include longer plastic pieces that attach to the base frame, lengthening the front (to greatly lessen the chance of forward flipping).The vibration of the seat is strong (though it only comes with one setting). I am able to comfortably rock it with my feet from the side while sitting in a chair or at the edge of my bed. It rocks smoothly-even on our carpeting. The rocking motion I use reminds me of an old fashioned sewing machine you work with your feet. I really love that it can handle 10-15 lbs. more weight than most swings(up to 40lbs).I like that it assembles quickly without a lot of pieces, so I can easily break it down to fit in a suitcase for travel (especially since it does NOT fold up when fully assembled). The seat cover is soft enough. It attaches with clasps in the back and comes off easily for washing. You can tuck the harness and straps completely through slots in the seat. This way, it is able to "disappear" when being used as a toddler rocker.There is an underside bar that swings forward in order to set the chair in a fixed recline. There are strong written warnings against using this for prolonged periods of sleep. The chair has an incline/decline feature. You have to depress both large green buttons (one on each side of the chair). This is fairly easy to do. There are visual markings (also on both sides) that indicate which setting the seat is in.The main issue I have is with the toy bar. These are hard plastic pieces that roughly swing in baby's face-even when gently rocking the chair. This is not soothing. Though I'm glad there's no possibility of one flying off (they are molded to the bar). It is frustrating that I cannot take these off to clean well or change them out for softer toys-or anything else, once baby gets bored.Unfortunately, the rocker squeaks when I rock it, but ONLY when the toy bar is on (the squeaking is coming from where the white plastic ends of the toy bar lock into the sockets affixed to the frame).There is no quiet way to take off this toy bar once baby is asleep. It is jarring. You also have to get a good, firm grip on both sides of the toy bar in order to get it off. Often, the bar catches on one side or the other if I'm not really careful.The toy bar's flat square and rectangle pieces have lion and giraffe STICKERS instead of being toy animals that can be held, so the play is limited. The cleaning challenge regarding stickers is also something to consider.I also noticed that the shapes of these paddles actually have a fanning effect when the seat is being rocked. Other family members can feel a definite chill coming from them swinging back and forth-not good for baby, especially in colder climates.There are hard plastic circles affixed to the top of the animal panels and elephant toy with smaller plastic dots along the actual bar. The 3 main (larger) circles have numbers "1," "2"and "3" engraved upon them. It would have been better if the actual numbers stood out more, so that baby can clearly see them (with different colors in print like the dots on the elephant). However, I am thankful that the numbers are engraved rather than also being stickers.The middle elephant is the heaviest piece on the toy bar. It takes three "Button Cell Batteries" that are included, though I wish they were a common battery type that the average person has on hand, to easily switch out. If you lightly grab the ring that dangles below it (with two much smaller rings attached), a couple bars of ONE song plays "Skip to My Lou."In all, I like the rocker itself, but the toy bar is disappointing.

The Playtex Drop-Ins Gift Set is a great gift for new mothers, or just a great way to save money on a great set of bottles. The Gift Set includes four bottles 2x 4 oz bottles and 2x 8-10oz bottles, a set of slow flow nipples ( 2 4oz, and 2 8-10oz nipples), as well as 30 pre-sterilized drop in disposable liners (15 4oz, 15 8-10oz).  You also get even more bonuses with this set including a breast pump adapter ring, liner ring, 2 sealing disks, 2 nipple rings, and a very handy instruction book.  These are awesome bottles and are great for babies who are making the transition from breast-feeding to bottle. I would highly recommend this set.
summary: A Great Gift for New Mothers!

reviewText: This is my second electrical pump. My first pump, the purely yours, did not work, it took 20 minutes to pump 1 oz. This pump is compact and light. Its easy to use and produces a lot of milk fast. I also have the Avent manual pump, which is also easy to use and produces milk at a good speed (faster than the purely yours). Avent pumps are very comfortable. You don't have to lean forward; you can lean back and relax. Also, the soft plastic is much more comfortable against my skin compared to the hard plastic of other pumps. I highly recommend this pump and I hope you love it as much as I do.

Definitely gives off a great stream of air, lightweight, and I don't have to worry about my daughter's fingers getting hurt.  Haven't had it long enough to know about battery life or the blades ripping but so far so good and for the price, you can't really go wrong.

I had a dinosaur of a swing that was a hand crank one I got way back with my first child. So when I was offered this one I was pretty ecstatic.  I have to say, it's one of my son's favorite spots (well, other than my arms!).  He is beyond the age where he really falls asleep in them, but I was really impressed at how happy he was to be swinging along in it.Pros:I love that you can flip it around to different positions: if your baby likes a sideways rock or a front-way rock, this swing can do it.The mobile is super shiny on the top so the baby can see a reflection of himself and the room in it. I thought the mobile looked very simple and he wouldn't like it because of it but I think because of the shiny area he was actually fascinated, just as much as the fancy mobile I bought him the month before.It's also super plush and cozy; and has great straps on it to really secure baby in there without being uncomfortable.  I love the fact that you can run it off of battery; but it's even BETTER that you can plug it into the wall.  That was a big one for me... I don't want to bother changing batteries all the time.cons:NONE!

These are well made, I like the cute fabric on the inside, and the fact they have two snaps so it's easy to adjust, however they get wet and leak immediately after the child has an accident, I like these if only the outside was plasticy to prevent that from happening.

My son has taken to this just fine when going potty in stores, etc.  It is a very good price for the product.  It takes a minute to figure out the first time you use it, then very, very easy.  I like the bag it comes with for storage, though just a simple plastic bag.  I do worry sometimes that it might collapse, though, which is why I only give 4 stars!
summary: Works nicely but could be improved

reviewText: I wanted a container for my son's extra pacifiers.  This fit the bill!  I have only had a few days-but I am not disappointed at all!
summary: Perfect size for the diaper bag!

reviewText: This thing is a life saver for me! I don't have a huge car to store a bunch of "On The Go" extras in the trunk and usually just carry my baby in a Ergo carrier for errands (I live in a big city, so everything is relatively within walking distance) but sometimes I have to be out for a couple of hours (aka Christmas Shopping!:) and can't keep my baby in his carrier for that long. that's where this little handy stroller comes into play!It is very lightweight, yet sturdy and is impressively compact compared to a standard stroller. There is a one handed fold and unfold mechanism (I found it stuck a little when it was brand new, so I would have to jiggle it a little but this disappeared after a couple of uses) and a deep basket underneath for storage.  The "snap" part of this stroller doesn't not mean the actual car seat is "snapped" into the frame, it has two straps the come from the bottom and buckle (there's the "snap") together on top of the car seat to keep it in place. When installed correctly (meaning buckled tightly) it feel very secure and safe. I was also impressed with its smooth ride and oscillating front wheels. :)One thing to Be Aware of: It is a little difficult to access the contents of the basket when car seat is in the frame. But this is only true if everything you need has been stuffed underneath in one big diaper bag. I found a bunch of cute smaller zipper pouches to hold various things - one for diapers and wipes, one for formula and bottles, one for extra clothes, that way I only have to retrieve a smaller pouch instead to trying to wrestle the diaper bag out and THEN rummage through that to find what I need! It just makes life easier for me :)

I started out with the Boppy pillow which after a couple of tries, I gave up on due to it not allowing my baby to be at an incline during nursing. The Gia pillow has been much better. It's so comfortable we often fall asleep together with my arms and babe propped on the pillow.

I was looking for a bottle that vented similar to the Dr. Browns bottle, but not with the straw because they leaked all the time.  So I thought I would try this Playtex Ventaire bottle and I have loved them!  I like that they vent from the back, no straw is necessary, and I haven't had any problems with this bottle leaking.I read reviews before buying this bottle and I just make sure to screw the bottom piece on tight and so far, no leaking at all.  I have been using these bottles now for about 2 months.

The fan is great - I feel comfortable if my baby accidently stuck his finger on it.  However, the clip is very hard to use.  Everything it clips on, it doesn't seem stable enough to stay put.  My husband is engineering something creative to clip this safely in our car.

These wipes are almost too nice to use for diaper changes!  FWIW My favorite wipes areGroVia Cotton Cloth Wipes.  I'm using the Thirsties wipes in the bath instead as baby washcloths, because they are so soft.  The two layers of fabric slide past each other, which sometimes made wiping up messes tricky.  Not that it really matters, but the wipes are colored on one side and white on the other, in case you care. UPDATE: I now keep these in a basket in the kitchen, and after each meal I use a damp cloth to wipe down my daughter's hands, face, tray and highchair.  I like that they have a "scrubbier" side (the colored side) and a softer side (the white side).

This is a good, no-frills pack n' play. By the time I bought it my son was too big for the bassinet, and would have been too big for any changing table feature that came on a pack n' play, so we went basic. He's so squirmy that it's better to change him on the floor now anyway. So this pack n' play is nice, love the modern gray, and provides a safe place for him to sleep when he is not at home.
It works, and it works well!! perfect! My 20 month old (3 foot 4 inch monster that he is) Can't even rip it off... Easy to use for adults.. Just push button and lift.
Just like the originals!!! Love to have these in handy because I sometimes loose the originals that come with sippy cups

This was a cute little car seat toy, and I would have used it if it would work with my Baby Trend car seat. The straps would fit on the carrier bar, but it was waaaay too close to baby's face b/c the bar didn't come down far enough to keep the toy at a better distance. It would have put the toy like, 2-3 inches from baby's face. Too close.Otherwise, seemed to be pretty nifty.
summary: Neat toy but didn't fit my Baby Trend

reviewText: I got it for my 8 month old and she was in love with it instantly. No spills = Happy Mommy :)I got Avent sippy as a gift, it's a big NO NO. Hope this helps!

I don't use these as wipes, but they're great for wash cloths. Way better than any of the cheap terry ones marketed for babies. For wipes I use a combination of kushies flannel wipes and bum genius wipes. While not as soft, they are more utilitarian and get the job done.
My son loves these sippy cups and takes them everywhere. When he loses one I don't worry because they were so cheap. They are very easy to clean and easy to store as well. A great purchase.
Not much I can say other than I LOVE these wipes! They hold up well in the wash and clean up big messes really well too. I would definitely re-order these.
My daughter loves to chew on this and when I put toothpaste on it, I can easily clean her teeth.
I like the concept, but my daughter does better with regular spoons.  Maybe it's because you have to start them off with these bendy ones right away.  My daughter is 16 months.
summary: Daughter hasn't figured these out yet

reviewText: This is great for new born babies, but after three months the bristles are just way too soft good-quality Nice-wood but do not recommend for long-term use
This definitely goes up there as one of the best teethers. I like that my son has lots of options for things to gum on. It's made really well!

As other reviewers have warned -- be aware there are only 9 tiles in this set so it doesn't cover much floor space.  I ended up needing to order 2 more sets to cover the area I initially thought one would cover.  Seems to have held up well over the past several months and definitely padded some falls that would have been much worse without the mat.  Definitely nice to have while your little one is just learning how to walk.
summary: Decent, but pricey for its size

reviewText: The rattle is not really a rattle to me but the different surfaces for my 8 month old teether is really good.
This teether is too hard and is a weird shape.  My baby did not like chewing on it at all and had a hard time getting it into his mouth.  Every baby is different though.

We bought 2 total, one for each floor of our house; we've had the first one for 16 months already, no issues at all.  Very simple look, goes well anywhere.  Be careful not to load too much weight on the bottom and middle shelves, it needs reinforcement to support extra weight; a simple metal bar like the top shelf is all that is needed. Assembly was not to bad, little tricky but doable.
for its price it is great and I am using it everyday . it is easy to clean . I use it for bottles and my breast pump accessories

I brought this in 2007 for my son. Now my daughter is using it now (2009). She is pretty big for a 3 month old and this chair is perfect. She's safe and she loves it. She had an accident once and I was able to remove the covering with ease, wash it, dry it, and put it back on with no problems at all. I don't use the vibrating option, but that's because it's not necessary for my child. This chair is durable and safe. I hope they will always make this chair.

Our daughter loves her froggy potty and she loves that it is so bright and lightweight. Yes, she picks it up to come show us her 'successes' but of course we don't mind. Its fun and may help encourage your little one to use the potty more easily.
These chimes are of such excellent quality that I now seek out other products by Bright Starts.  So nice to find a company that actually seems to care and focus on quality.

Very colorful and not gender specific at all!!!Costs the same anywhere else but the shipping was quick and hassle free!!I hope my little one will like it when it comes to growing teeth.!!ALSO very gentile rattle noise

I love these diapers and am actually sad now that my little girl has almost outgrown them at 5 months. I prefer prefolds with covers for newborns because they just go through so many diapers, and prefolds are the most cost effective option since cotton is so affordable and you can reuse the covers throughout the day. Prefolds also give you the option of trying different folds to work with your baby's body type and growth rate. These launder great, get softer and more absorbent with each wash, and still look really good after five months of continuous use. I was very happy that these held up just as good as some other more expensive cloth diaper options. We used these with Thirsties Duo Snap Wrap covers and it was a great combination. These do shrink some in the wash, and definitely need to be prepped first.

When I first started using cloth wipes, I only had a toddler and was using them infrequently. After one week I noticed a burnt smell and found my pad had brown dry spots on it. Once I had a newborn and was using wipes regularly again, I gave it another try. First, I wiped down the inside of the warmer in case that was the problem. The pillow lasted a little longer this time until I noticed a funky smell on my wipes. Now on my third pillow, I've been flipping it every day and adding more water ever 2-3 days. It is STILL developing a funky smell. Ugh. I'm going to use the warmer without it as reviewers have suggested and see what happens.To be fair, we have hard water and we have the same problems with our humidifier filters. No matter how often I flip them, replace the water, or clean the humidifier, they get crunchy and gross quickly. (That is, until I discovered the antimicrobial solution you can add to them. I wish there were something like that for these.)
summary: Gets crunchy burn spots, bad smell

reviewText: Although my baby's room tends to be the warmest room in the house leaving the ceiling fan on cools it to almost too cool.  We used the HALO 100% Cotton SleepSack for a lightweight option to keep him warm and cozy for a full nights sleep.  It fits easily over his onesie.  Most nights he sleeps through with no problems, but if he were to need a diaper change in the middle of the night the zipper zipping from the bottom makes it really easy with out disturbing him too much.  He is able to move around easily in the sleepsack including sitting up.  This is important since he is a mover in his sleep.  He is never in the same spot for long while sleeping.  As he moves around I don't have to worry that he will have a blanket wrapped around him with the sleepsack.  I know that he can move around to get comfortable and he is safe while doing it.

We were gifted the BabyDeedee Sleep Nest original and loved it for the colder/cooler months, but with the Summer heat quickly approaching, that was no longer a good option.  The Halo Sleep Sack cotton is fine, but I felt still a little thin and light when we have the A/C or fan going.  The fleece kind doesn't seem breathable in the hot months.  Plus, just like adults, I'm sure baby sleeps more peacefully with a little bit of added weight.  Especially as they're still getting those muscle twitches and flailing around a bit at night!  This is the perfect weight!  Two layers of soft knit jersey!  I worried about buying the 0-6 for my 3+ month old and having her outgrow it too fast, but it's actually really spacious and will have plenty of room for her to grow!  The zipper is nicer than any other sleep sacks we've tried - doesn't bunch up around her neck.  And the SNAPS at the shoulder are wonderful in case baby's already fallen asleep before you remembered to put the sleep sack on!  No need to wake baby up - just snap in!  Highly recommend!
I love this potty. It is the same or better than the expensive baby bjorn ones. My tiny 18 month old has no trouble sitting on it her self. Easy to clean out. Would definitely recommend!

These were great for my son's infant carseat!  I wish we'd bought them sooner.  So many strap covers have pictures of them in suse where the carseat's harness clip is too low because the strap cover is too long, which is dangerous and would be very uncomfortable for a child in a crash!  This one was just the right length to protect my son's neck from the edge of the strap while still allowing the carseat to be properly fastened.  I bought another set just like it when we got his covertible carseat.We keep the cover turned to the fuzzy side all year long even though it's really hot here because the quilted side just seems a little rough.
I gave this as a gift and the baby was fascinated and loved this toy. He played with for hours. It was durable and well made and held his interest.

I bought my first my breast friend pillow 4 years ago when I was pregnant with my first baby.  This product was recommended by a lady whom my husband and I took the infant care/breast feeding class from.  I wasn't so sure if this thing was going to work because all other moms that I knew had boppy pillow; no one had this one.  I didn't want to spend much money on something that might or might not work, so I went with the cheap solution-- I bought the inflatable my breast friend travel pillow.  When my baby was born and I started to use it, I immediately fell in love.  It was supposed to be "travel" pillow, but I used it at home.  It helped tremendously with breastfeeding.  I would have given up breastfeeding if I had not had this pillow.  After almost 10 months of use, the cover started to show some wear and zipper for the cover was hard to close.  After 12 months, zipper just broke.  Around the same time, the pillow started to deflate.  I found the location of the leak, but I was unable to fix it.  Oh well, I only paid 20 dollars for this inflatable pillow, so I got my money's worth and I had no complaints  I did breastfeeding until my baby was 18 months.  After 12 months, I didn't really have to have the pillow because I knew how to breastfeed and the baby was getting big and I could feed the baby without the support of the pillow( and by this time baby eats food, so you don't have to breastfeed as much anyway). .  Last year when I found out that I was pregnant with my second baby, one of the first items that got on my "must have" items was my breast friend pillow.  This time, I knew this thing works and I did not hesitate to spend 40 dollars for it.  This Time, I went for the deluxe.  I have a six month old baby and I use this daily.  I told my friends about this pillow and they went for this pillow instead of boppy pillow.  I am super happy with this product.
summary: This is my second breast friend pillow...  I love it.

reviewText: I brought this for my 2 year olds car seat after recently potty training her. I LOVE it! Saves having to haul the seat out to remove the cover and wash it. The butt side is a nice fabric, the seat side is waterproof. Great product.

It is definitely the best swing on the market with all of its bells and whistles, stability, versatility, and even looks.  I have had lots of people comment on just how comfortable it looks.  The dual swing action is nice but, my boy only seems to like swinging side to side so, we never really used the front to back motion.  Now, that he is six months he doesn't really seem to like swinging at all.  He does like to just chill out in it especially later in the evening as it gets closer to his bedtime.As others have mentioned it does swing very fast even on the lowest setting.  We still have not gone past first gear.  The weight of the child will dictate how fast it swings.  We threaded a towel between the cushion and seat support and let it drag on the floor for the first 4 months to slow it down.
These are perfect for a changing pad.Wash great but DO NOT put in the dryer as it backing will flake off and not be water proof anymore.
It's a nice size but the suction cups don't hold at all. Takes a lot to get it to stick.
summary: Like it but wouldn't buy again

reviewText: I bought this slipcover for my Barenaked Boppy before I knew whether I was having a boy or a girl. Her nursery was done in safari animals since we didn't find out until she arrived. This is a very cute neutral slipcover.

We purchased one for our house, one for the grandparents and one for the sitter since my son spends almost an equal amount of time at all three. It's a simple, effective design and my son has really taken to it and almost "potty trained himself" once he learned that he is supposed to do what the grown-ups do except he does it in his special potty. Great price and does what is intended. No need for overkill on kiddie potties. This is great value for the money and does what it needs to do.
summary: My 2yr old Kid Gets it... Bought 3

reviewText: I don't know anyone feeds their baby without these, unless you don't mind food all over your child's clothes.  Even the most mild eater gets food on themselves.  These are awesome.  They cover everything my son is wearing and are easily rinse-able.  I have 2 and alternate so one is always dry for the next meal.  Would highly recommend.

We have a lot of stuffed animals and this hammock is a great way to keep them somewhat organized and off the floor in the kid's room.  It is also a good storage solution if you have a dog that likes to take things that are left on the floor.  We hung the hammock in the corner above a chair, which otherwise would have been wasted space.  The toys look cute and the room is less cluttered. it is very sturdy. I think we are pretty close to the weight limit and it doesn't budge.We also used the toy chain it comes with for teethers and other small toys. It isn't something I would buy separately, but at least we use it. The chain is just cheap plastic and you hook the clips on wherever you want. The hooks fall off easily if you don't have a toy weighing them down.
summary: Hammock is great for stuffed animals

reviewText: These wipes are still going strong after probably hundreds of washes. But they are expensive to purchase. They do a great job of "grabbing" dirty messes.

Okay I'd admit I bought this because it got great reviews and I am not disappointed at all. In fact it is now on my must give list to new moms. It really does work giving you only one wipe at a time. I think it looks nicer than the plastic disposable boxes. I love buying the refills and not having to recycle the plastic containers. Even if you reused them a few times it seems like you'd have to eventually replace it while this one will last years.

I read the reviews about the sheet being too small. I ordered it anyway. I should have listened to the reviews. When the sheet arrived, I washed it and put it on. It was small, but not too small. I thought I was in the clear. However, after a few more washings, she sheet is definitely too small. So small, in fact, that I ripped it getting it on the mattress. Nice fabric, cute pattern, soft, but it doesn't matter anyway because the dang thing is too small for a standard crib mattress.

I choose this product for my daughter to have for when the baby is not in the crib. She says it makes it so much easier for her to do other chores in the house because she can take this everywhere and put the baby in it.

After our first horrible potty with my first daughter- it was one with all the songs and pee sensor and looks like a real toilet. I HATED THAT THING. The hole was too small so half the time pee would go out, and it didn't have a built in guard and not having experience I threw the one away that was "just for boys." HA WHAT A JOKE. Girls still spray forward occasionally! It also had tons of places to trap pee and was a nightmare to keep clean.My youngest is 19 months and 31in tall and this is perfect height and depth. This time around I wisened up and bought the most simple potty that was still fun for my daughter. I went back and forth between this and the bjorn, but I kept reading reviews that the kids were sitting on the bjorns splash guard and getting scared of the potty. I was pleased to find this new frog model because the built in guard is slightly narrower than the old frog (that one has a guard shaped like an "m" and dips between the eyes). I like that it is not as wide as the old one because they don't have to spread their legs as far apart. This is really light which is nice to take in the car, it has a handle in the back, and very limited areas for old pee to collect and dry! After every use I spray with cleaner and after poos I scrub with a clorox wipe. It is so easy to keep clean. My daughter sat on it the first day and went poo poo and pee! We have been using this for less than a week and she already stays dry most of the time. She takes off for this cute little froggie when she has to go because it is so fun! I am still careful to help her sit so she doesn't sit on the guard and become afraid of the potty, but I definatly would rather do that than clean pee from the floor! And this has a more rounded guard than the bjorn so just incase it shouldn't hurt as bad. This is such a great price you can get one for upstairs and one to keep in the car!GET THIS ONE.
summary: Yes girls also need a pee guard.

reviewText: We've used this bag to store our bath toys for a while now. I was disappointed that it started to have some mildew spots after a year or so of use but I found if you take the suction cup bar off and throw it in the washer it comes out looking like new. I like that my son can put his toys away and take them out by himself, there's no complicated buttons to deal with and the toys are securely off the bath floor.

With my second child, I decided to take the plunge into cloth diapering.  I did a TON of research before deciding to try Softbums.  I chose this system bc it seemed like the easiest way to go and the system my husband was most likely to buy off on.  He did.  We have only been using them for a few days, but we are both completely sold.  We use the mini pods for our newborn.  The super pods will be MUCH too big for some time.  We use the bamboo during the day and the microfiber at night.  I bought some of each to try, but the microfiber pods are much bulkier and less absorbent (go figure) so for the sake of the diaper fitting under clothes and her not looking like she is all butt, we use the bamboo during the day for a trimmer fit.  They are as easy as disposables to put on and changing the pods are super easy.  I really love these diapers.  The only leak problems we have had are when my husband has failed to tuck the pod completely into the shell, so operator error.  Since we have only used them on a newborn, I can't testify to their performance on a mobile baby.  And with waking up every few hours in the night, I am not sure how the absorbency will go when she is asleep for a whole night, but what I have seen so far has made me very optimistic.I deduct a star because I find their customer service to be really lacking.  I went to their website to purchase a large package with pods, but they were out of the pods forever, despite several promises of "next week."  I got tired of waiting and ordered from Sweet Bottoms Baby for the same price except with free shipping.  I also don't like that they don't have prints except for their "calendar bums" and I have not been super impressed with those.  They have older calendar prints available, but they are all very boy leaning.  The only color they have for girls is the pink and it is not the same as it looks online.  It is the color of a hunk of Double Bubble gum- not cute.  You can find pics all over the internet of really cute girl prints, but they have all been discontinued.Overall, a great system to use, but poor customer service from the company and less options for colors and prints for baby girls.  Those points annoy me, but I get around the customer service thing by shopping elsewhere and the look of them is not as important as the ease of use, so I sacrifice cuteness for function.
summary: A really great intro to cloth

reviewText: The s/o wanted something that could recline in the forward or rear-facing position. Check. I wanted something that wasn't impossible to carry. Half-check. Having borrowed other car seats from a friend, the Boulevard is heavy but not unliftable. The baby finds it comfortable enough. We have secured it rear and forward facing using the seatbelt and forward facing using the iso-fix clips. I hope this is the last car seat I'll have to buy. Stating the obvious, if you travel you'll need a wheeled cover for this.
summary: Comfortable and heavy but not impossibly so

reviewText: Purchased for wife, but didn't fit.  We have a Snugli seated military carrier and it is awesome.  We were looking for a second carrier that would work for our younger, smaller son since the Snugli is for 16 pounds and up.  This carrier is ergonomic like it claims, but it was too long for her (she's 5'1") and she uses the Snugli with no problems.  The other issue she had was the way it hooks together.  The Snugli doesn't attach the "arms" to the waist belt, but this Union carrier does.  That makes it really hard to put on without a partner, which is what she needed it for since I work during the day and she stays home with the kids.  On the plus side, the return process was fast and easy (prime member), although we would have preferred not to need to.
summary: Great price for ergonomic carrier, but too long for petite mom
